0.title: School kids greet PM Modi with songs in UP's Varanasi, video surfaces
0.article_body: School children greeted Prime Minister Narendra Modi by singing songs in Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi on Thursday. A video shared by BJP MP Anurag Thakur shows the Prime Minister sitting with a group of students who perform one by one. A boy played a drum in front of PM Modi, who praised him saying 'Shabash'.

1.title: 3 TMC workers killed by unidentified attackers in West Bengal
1.article_body: Three Trinamool Congress (TMC) workers were killed by unidentified attackers in the South 24 Parganas district of West Bengal on Thursday morning, police said. The deceased TMC workers, identified as Swapan Manjhi, Bhootnath Pramanik and Jantu Haldar, were on a bike when the attackers shot at them. The initial investigation suggests it seems to be a case of political violence.

2.title: Vivo India sent 50% of its income to China to avoid paying taxes: ED
2.article_body: The Indian arm of Chinese smartphone maker Vivo remitted 50% of its turnover to China to avoid paying taxes here, the Enforcement Directorate (ED) said. Around ₹62,476 crore of Vivo India's income was remitted to disclose huge losses in Indian incorporated companies, the agency said. Funds worth ₹465 crore in 119 banks linked to Vivo India entities have been seized.

3.title: Form welfare board for autorickshaw, taxi drivers: Sena MLA to Shinde
3.article_body: Rebel Shiv Sena MLA Uday Samant on Thursday urged Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde to form a board for the welfare of autorickshaw and taxi drivers in the state on the lines of Tamil Nadu. In a letter to Shinde, Samant said the move will benefit 8.32 lakh licensed autorickshaw and 90,000 taxi drivers and owners.

4.title: Kapil's show in New York postponed; Promoter says it's due to scheduling conflict
4.article_body: Kapil Sharma's show in New York has been postponed. The local promoter of the show shared on its website that the gig has been postponed due to a "scheduling conflict". The date of Kapil's New York show hasn't been announced yet but for audiences who've already booked their tickets for July 9, their ticket stands valid for the next date.

5.title: Madras HC dismisses pleas against ex-CM Edappadi Palaniswami
5.article_body: The Madras High Court on Thursday dismissed contempt applications against former Chief Minister Edappadi K Palaniswami for allegedly disregarding its June 23 orders. The pleas were dismissed as the Supreme Court stayed the June 23 orders, which restrained the AIADMK from passing resolutions on its leadership. Palaniswami's supporters are pushing for him to be the party's top leader.

6.title: Setu gets in-principle RBI nod to operate as an account aggregator
6.article_body: Agya Technology, a subsidiary of Pine Labs-owned fintech platform Setu, has received in-principle approval from the Reserve Bank of India to operate as an account aggregator (AA). The approval came on July 4. This will allow Setu to launch its own AA platform. AAs are non-banking financial companies that enable sharing and access to data between financial institutions.

7.title: Over 6 million Sri Lankans facing food insecurity amid inflation: UN
7.article_body: The UN World Food Programme (WFP) has said that over six million Sri Lankans are facing food insecurity due to rising inflation amid the country's ongoing economic crisis. Some 61% of households in the country are using coping strategies, such as cutting down their food expenses, WFP's assessment noted. Sri Lanka currently has an inflation rate of over 50%.

8.title: BJP chose Murmu as Prez candidate to gain tribal votes: Medha Patkar
8.article_body: Social activist Medha Patkar claimed that the BJP has fielded Droupadi Murmu as NDA's Presidential candidate only because tribal community forms a major part of the vote bank. "They cannot claim to be pro-Adivasi by not granting them forest rights and planning to hand over forests to the corporates," she said. The Presidential election will be held on July 18.

9.title: Goa's flood monitoring system hacked; hackers seek ransom in crypto
9.article_body: Goa's flood monitoring system was hacked by ransomware attackers who have demanded payment in cryptocurrency to release data, according to a police complaint filed by the state's water resources department. "The attack was carried out on June 21, 2022 midnight between 12am-2am. The integrity of the data has been altered making it impossible to back up...previous data," the complaint stated.

10.title: Who is Shivon Zilis, the executive with whom Elon Musk reportedly welcomed twins?
10.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk welcomed twins with Shivon Zilis, a top executive at his brain-chip startup Neuralink, in November 2021, reports said. The 36-year-old, who grew up in Canada and attended Yale University, has worked as a Project-Director at Tesla. She's a founding member of the investment team at Bloomberg Beta and also featured in Forbes' 30 under 30 list.

11.title: Central Vista Avenue redevelopment project to be completed by July 18
11.article_body: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Thursday said the redevelopment project of Central Vista Avenue from Vijay Chowk to India Gate, will be completed by July 18. He said some minor works are currently being carried out at one or two underpasses. Earlier, he said that Delhiites would be pleasantly surprised to see how the area is being totally transformed.

12.title: Haven't decided yet: TMC on taking disciplinary action against Moitra
12.article_body: TMC MP Saugata Roy on Thursday said the party hasn't taken any decision regarding taking disciplinary action against the party's MP Mahua Moitra over her remarks on Goddess Kali. "[TMC]...will make a decision at an appropriate time," he said, adding, "We don't approve of such comments." Notably, Moitra had said, "For me, Goddess Kali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess."

13.title: 3 Pune health officers caught for taking bribe from sonography centre
13.article_body: Maharashtra ACB has arrested three health department officers from Pune, including the district civil surgeon, for allegedly demanding a bribe for issuing a licence renewal certificate to a private sonography centre. According to the statement issued by ACB's DSP Shrihari Patil, the officers at the civil hospital in Aundh allegedly demanded ₹40,000 for issuing the renewal certificate.

14.title: Kashi best example of 'Sabka Sath, Sabka Vikas': PM Modi
14.article_body: After laying foundation stone for projects worth around ₹1,800 crore in his Lok Sabha constituency Varanasi, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said Kashi is the best example of 'Sabka Sath, Sabka Vikas'. "For us, development means poor, underprivileged, backward, tribals, women and old people feel empowered...we're ensuring work to get each poor a pucca house," PM Modi said.

15.title: 24-yr-old biker dies after speeding trailer rams into him in Thane
15.article_body: A 24-year-old biker died after a trailer mowed him down in Bhiwandi on Wednesday. "The deceased has been identified as Rahman Asrar Shah...He was going...towards Thane for personal work when the trailer came from behind and rammed into him...The driver who fled the spot was...speeding," police said. The victim, who was taken to a hospital, was declared dead before arrival.

16.title: Retd Kerala teacher builds temple that worships Indian Constitution
16.article_body: A Kerala-based 71-year-old retired social science teacher, Sivadasan Pillai, has built a temple where the main deity is Indian Constitution. "For me, my lord is Constitution and I worship it," Pillai said. The temple carries photos of Mahatma Gandhi, Swami Vivekananda, BR Ambedkar and Nobel Laureate Malala Yousafzai. The Preamble of the Constitution is etched on the temple's wall.

17.title: Producer Sandeep Singh threatened with 'Moosewala-like' death on FB, case filed
17.article_body: Film producer Sandeep Singh allegedly received a death threat on his Facebook account and filed a complaint at a local police station in Mumbai, police said. A case has been filed against an unknown person for threatening Singh with a death similar to singer Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead in May. Actor Salman Khan was earlier similarly threatened.

18.title: Go and sit on a beach: Michael Vaughan while suggesting 3-month break to Virat Kohli
18.article_body: Former England captain Michael Vaughan has said that Team India batter Virat Kohli needs a sabbatical. "Kohli looks like he needs three months away from cricket. Go and sit on a beach," Vaughan added. He further stated, "To have a three months break, is it going to affect him? No. Will it help him? Yes."

19.title: Tell your mate he isn't a thug: Tino to reporter over English media's treatment of Kohli
19.article_body: Ex-West Indies pacer Tino Best took to Twitter to defend Virat Kohli over English media criticising his aggression during Edgbaston Test. Reacting to a reporter's tweet over Kohli's celebration of Alex Lees' wicket, Best said, "Anyone who's bold, brown or black, y'all always got a damn problem with." He added, "Tell your mate...Virat isn't a thug...He's a modern day Icon...Simple."

20.title: Congrats on your first film as producer: Anushka to Alia for Darlings' teaser
20.article_body: Anushka Sharma congratulated Alia Bhatt on her film Darlings' teaser. "This looks lit," she wrote on Instagram. Besides, Anushka also sent wishes to Alia for donning the hat of a producer for the first time. "Congratulations, Alia...on your first film as...producer," she added. To this, Alia replied, "Thank you, my dearest Anushkaaa." Darlings is set to release on August 5.

21.title: 2 people given beheading threats in Rajasthan, police start probe
21.article_body: At least two men in Rajasthan's Bharatpur have allegedly received beheading threats by unknown persons in past 10 days, police said. An ambulance driver on Wednesday was approached by two unknown persons and handed over the threatening note, which was addressed to persons named Satish and Pramod, police said. This comes after a tailor was beheaded in Udaipur last month.

22.title: Man gets 5-year jail term for sexually assaulting minor girl in Hyd
22.article_body: A court in Hyderabad on Thursday sentenced a man to five years in jail for sexually assaulting a minor girl in February 2017. The victim was returning to her home from school when the accused stopped her. The man had previously also attempted to molest the girl under Kanchanbagh police station limits.

23.title: Chhattisgarh announces bagless day on Saturdays; kids to play sports
23.article_body: The Chhattisgarh government has announced bagless day in schools on Saturdays. The schools will organise yoga, sports and cultural activities on this day. An official said that the step has been introduced by the Department of School Education to make school education interesting and school principals will be asked to plan the activities for each Saturday of the month.

24.title: Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air gets DGCA license to start commercial operations
24.article_body: Billionaire Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air has received its Air Operator Certificate (AOC) from the DGCA, the aviation regulator said on Thursday. The airline will reportedly begin commercial flight operations later this month. Announcing the AOC's receipt, the airline said, "This is a significant milestone, enabling us to open our flights for sale."

25.title: PM launches, lays foundation stone of ₹1800-crore projects in Varanasi
25.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday inaugurated and laid the foundation stone of multiple development projects worth over ₹1800 crore in UP's Varanasi. These projects include those relating to urban development, re-development of Namo Ghat, the heritage of Kashi, etc. During an event in Varanasi, PM Modi said, "Projects being launched in Varanasi will give momentum to the city's development journey."

26.title: India reacts to UK PM's resignation, says 'PM Modi & Johnson enjoyed close friendship'
26.article_body: After Boris Johnson resigned as the Prime Minister of the UK, India's External Affairs Ministry spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said, "PM Narendra Modi and PM Johnson enjoyed a close friendship." "These are internal developments, we are keeping a close watch...We have a multi-faceted partnership with the UK and we hope this will continue. We won't comment on leadership change," he added.

27.title: Uddhav still Sena chief, rebel group doesn't have recognition: MP
27.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Arvind Sawant on Thursday asserted that Uddhav Thackeray continues to be the Sena chief and stated that the rebel group doesn't have any recognition. "Even if two-thirds of the MLAs go, Uddhav Thackeray remains the Sena chief and according to law, only he is the one who can appoint a leader of the legislature party," he said.

28.title: JNU not against dhabas, but they've to follow rules & pay bills: VC
28.article_body: JNU Vice-Chancellor Santishree Dhulipudi Pandit said that the administration was not against the dhabas or canteens being there, but they have to follow the rules and pay their bills. "We are only trying to legalise. We are trying to say you pay the rent and electricity bill. They don't want to pay anything. They want everything free," she said.

29.title: Killings of 2 men from Manipur in Myanmar trigger protests
29.article_body: Protests erupted in Manipur's Moreh on Wednesday over the killing of two Tamil men from the state in a border town in Myanmar. The protesters also crossed the international border and torched a sentry post of Myanmar army. The bodies of P Mohan and M Iyarnar, who were shot dead, were found in Tamu on Tuesday.

30.title: Tata Projects, Power Grid executives arrested for bribery; ₹93 lakh cash seized
30.article_body: Senior executives of Power Grid Corporation of India and Tata Projects are among seven people arrested by CBI for alleged bribery to favour the private firm. Power Grid Executive Director BS Jha, Tata Projects Executive VP Deshraj Pathak and Assistant VP RN Singh have been arrested. Officials also recovered ₹93 lakh cash during a raid on Jha's Gurugram premises.

31.title: AAP shares pics from Bhagwant Mann and Gurpreet Kaur's wedding
31.article_body: AAP shared pictures from Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann and Dr Gurpreet Kaur's wedding on Thursday and wrote, "Punjab CM [Bhagwant Mann] & Dr. Gurpreet Kaur begin their married life. May God bless the Mann family with all the happiness in the world." Pictures showed the couple with Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and his family. Raghav Chadha also attending the wedding.

32.title: 3 tribals killed, 3 injured after being struck by lightning in MP
32.article_body: Three tribals were killed and three others suffered severe burn injuries after being struck by lightning in forest area in Madhya Pradesh's Sheopur, a police official said on Thursday. The victims identified as 28-year-old Rambharat Adivasi, 27-year-old Dilip Adivasi and 20-year-old Mukesh Adivasi went for a picnic in the Ajnoi forest area when the lightning struck them, police added.

33.title: Mumbai woman cheated of ₹3.7 lakh while selling furniture for ₹21,000
33.article_body: A 26-year-old Mumbai woman trying to sell furniture worth ₹21,000 online ended up losing ₹3.77 lakh to cyber fraud. According to the complainant, her company's manager asked her to collect the money from selling furniture for ₹21,000 on an online marketplace. The buyer, who turned out to be a cyber-fraudster, sent a QR code and made transactions worth ₹3.77 lakh.

34.title: TV set, desktop monitor stolen from Zilla Parishad school in Navi Mumbai
34.article_body: A television set and a desktop monitor were stolen from a Zilla Parishad school in Navi Mumbai's Taloja Panchanand area last week, police said. The thieves committed the crime after cutting the grill of the school building when no one was present there. The school authorities have registered a complaint at the Taloja police station.

35.title: B'luru Traffic Police announce deviations to ease traffic in Hebbal
35.article_body: The Bengaluru Traffic Police have come out with a fresh set of rules to decongest traffic on the Hebbal flyover and have blocked two crossover points in front of Manipal Hospital and Esteem Mall signal. "These changes have been proposed after studying the flow of vehicles at this junction, checking...data and factors causing traffic congestions," Bengaluru Traffic Police tweeted.

36.title: Ukraine to summon Turkish envoy after Russian ship with 'stolen grain' leaves
36.article_body: Ukraine has said that it will summon Turkey's ambassador to seek clarification after a Russian-flagged cargo ship allegedly carrying 'stolen' Ukrainian grain left a Turkish port. It is "unacceptable" that the Russian ship Zhibek Zholy was allowed to leave Karasu port despite "criminal evidence presented to the Turkish authorities", Ukrainian Foreign Ministry spokesperson Oleg Nikolenko said.

37.title: Very proud of my govt's achievements: Boris as he resigns as UK PM
37.article_body: Boris Johnson, who on Thursday resigned as UK's PM, said he's "immensely proud" of his government's achievements, adding that he'll remain caretaker PM until new leader is chosen. "To...millions of people who voted for us in 2019...Thank you for that incredible mandate," he added. Johnson quit after over 50 MPs of his party resigned in protest against his leadership.

38.title: NITI Aayog ex-CEO Kant to replace Piyush Goyal as G20 Sherpa: Reports
38.article_body: Former NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant will replace Union Minister Piyush Goyal as the Sherpa for the G20 Summit, reports said. Goyal reportedly requested Kant to take up the role because of his busy schedule. With G20 Presidency coming to India in December, a full-time Sherpa will reportedly be needed to devote a lot of time to meetings across India.

39.title: Aim behind NEP is to integrate education with modern ideas: PM Modi
39.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday inaugurated the three-day Akhil Bharatiya Shiksha Samagam in Varanasi. During the event, he said, "The foundational aim behind the National Education Policy is to bring education out from the limits of narrow thought-process and to integrate it with the modern ideas of...21st century." "NEP is paving the way for education in regional languages," he added.

40.title: Pune's SSPU invites startups to apply for ₹1-5 lakh funding, guidance
40.article_body: Savitribai Phule Pune University's (SSPU) Centre for Innovation, Incubation and Linkages is inviting early-stage startups to provide guidance and funding between ₹1 lakh to ₹5 lakh. Through its new pre-incubation platform, 'Power 2022,' the first five selected startups will be provided with the funds. The money will be given from the funds received from the Maharashtra State Innovation Society.

41.title: What are 'Nairobi flies', the skin-burning insects infecting students in Sikkim?
41.article_body: Over a hundred students of a Sikkim engineering college recently suffered severe skin infections due to 'Nairobi flies'. The small, beetle-like insects, which are orange and black in colour, thrive in areas with high rainfall. Health officials said these flies don't bite, but if disturbed while sitting on anyone's skin, they release potent acidic substance 'pederin' that causes burns.

42.title: Apologise to Delhi people for calling them thieves: AAP to LG
42.article_body: AAP on Thursday accused Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena of calling Delhi people "thieves" and demanded an apology for asking people to pay taxes to the civic body "honestly". "By the grace of God, you (LG) are sitting in a very responsible position. Delhi people only want cleanliness. There is no problem in paying taxes," said AAP's Durgesh Pathak.

43.title: 2-month-old crocodile rescued from a well in Thane
43.article_body: A baby crocodile, around two months old, was rescued from a well in Thane's Wagle Estate on Wednesday. It was rescued by Wildlife Welfare Association (WWA) and handed over to the forest department. "Well is not a natural habitat of crocodiles...someone might have brought it from a different place and thrown it in," an official of Thane forest department said.

44.title: I like to be a part of original stories: Ranbir on working in Shamshera
44.article_body: Speaking about working in Shamshera, Ranbir Kapoor said he likes to be a part of original stories and loves to have original music in his films. "Remixes...have their own place in the world and...audiences enjoy it. But, I like to be part of...original music," he added. "A lot of my success...has come through the music of my films," Ranbir said.

45.title: Man kills friend for not returning phone post call, held in Delhi
45.article_body: The Delhi Police have arrested a Nepali man for allegedly killing his friend for refusing to return his phone after making a call. According to DCP (central district) Shweta Chauhan, the accused killed the deceased after he refused to return his phone after making a phone call. The deceased also slapped the accused and called him a thief, Chauhan said.

46.title: 2 drug peddlers held in B'luru, 12 grams of MDMA crystals seized
46.article_body: Bengaluru City Police's Central Crime Branch (CCB) has arrested two drug peddlers from Sanjay Nagar, the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime), Raman Gupta, said on Thursday. Police seized 12 grams of MDMA crystals, 27 grams of manufactured drug brown sugar and two mobile phones worth ₹3 lakh from the accused.

47.title: Finland passes law on more security on Russian border amid NATO bid
47.article_body: The Finnish parliament on Thursday voted to approve legislation that would allow barriers along the country's 1300-km long border with Russia. The legislation would also enable the closure of the border for refugees in case of exceptional circumstances. This comes days after NATO member countries officially signed off on the accession protocols for Finland and Sweden's induction into the bloc.

48.title: Iran detains several foreigners, a UK diplomat for spying
48.article_body: Iran's Revolutionary Guards have detained several foreigners, including Britain's second most senior envoy in Tehran, for alleged acts of spying. "These spies were taking earth samples in Iran's central desert where the Revolutionary Guards' aerospace missile exercises were conducted," state TV stated. "Reports of the arrest of a British diplomat in Iran are...false," UK's foreign office said.

49.title: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson resigns
49.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson has resigned after over 50 Members of Parliament resigned in protest at his leadership. This comes after UK's new Finance Minister asked Johnson to "go now", saying that the situation was "not sustainable and will only get worse". Johnson's supporters - including Priti Patel and Grant Shapps - had also urged him to step down.

50.title: 2 Punjab Police officers arrested for extorting money, possessing heroin
50.article_body: The Special Task Force (STF) of the Punjab Police arrested two police constables with 5 grams of heroin and seized ₹19,000 cash from them. The duo allegedly extorted money from a person, who possessed the contraband, in order to let him go. One of the accused is presently posted as  gunman with singer Mankirt Aulakh, STF officials said.

51.title: Rwanda, DR Congo agree to reduce tensions over rebel offensive
51.article_body: The Democratic Republic of the Congo and Rwanda have agreed to de-escalate tensions sparked due to an offensive by M23 rebels in DRC's eastern borderlands, the Congolese presidency announced on Wednesday after a summit in Angola. The agreement included an immediate cessation of hostilities and the retreat of M23 fighters, it added. The DRC has accused Rwanda of backing M23.

52.title: ICMR-VCRC creates special female mosquitoes to control dengue, chikungunya
52.article_body: ICMR-Vector Control Research Centre (VCRC) has developed special female mosquitoes to control dengue and chikungunya. Female mosquitoes will mate with males and produce larvae that do not carry these viruses. Two colonies of Aedes aegypti, infected with wMel and wAlbB Wolbachia strains called Ae aegypti (Pud), have been developed to decrease spread of the diseases.

53.title: Home Minister Amit Shah virtually unveils 'Statue of Peace' in Srinagar
53.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah virtually unveiled the 'Statue of Peace' of Swamy Ramanujacharya located in a temple in the Sonwar region of Srinagar on Thursday. "This will be a message of peace in not only Kashmir but the whole country," Shah said. Saint Ramanujacharya, also known as Ramanuja, is revered as a Vedic philosopher and social reformer.

54.title: Eijaz Khan hospitalised due to typhoid & fever, shares glimpse from hospital
54.article_body: Actor Eijaz Khan has recently been hospitalised due to typhoid and fever. Taking to Instagram Story, he shared a picture of his hand. In the picture, Eijaz is seen resting on the hospital bed and several syringes have been attached to his hand.  Sharing the photo, he mentioned in scientific terms that he has been diagnosed with Typhoid and fever.

55.title: Harry Maguire 'likes' Instagram post about Ronaldo being upset at Man Utd
55.article_body: Manchester United captain Harry Maguire reportedly liked an Instagram post that claimed Cristiano Ronaldo was unhappy at the club due to the recent salary cut. Maguire has since unliked the post and has said he clicked the button in error. Earlier, it was reported that Ronaldo has told Manchester United that he wants to leave the club.

56.title: We make mistakes, can be rectified: Mamata after Mahua faces FIR over her remark
56.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday said, "We make mistakes while working but they can be rectified." Her statement comes at a time when TMC's Mahua Moitra is facing FIRs over her remarks on Goddess Kali. "Some people don't see all the good work and suddenly start shouting...Negativity affects our brain cells so let's think positively," she added.

57.title: 53-yr-old Tripura woman clears board exams with daughters, says 'I'm happy'
57.article_body: A 53-year-old woman, Shila Rani Das, from Tripura has passed her 10th board exams at the same time when her daughters have cleared their 12th board exams. "I am happy that I've passed the exam. My daughters and other people supported me and inspired me to do it. I was confident that I will clear the exam," Das said.

58.title: Mismanagement caused DDA's liabilities to exceed ₹10,000 cr: Delhi LG
58.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena on Thursday said the Delhi Development Authority (DDA) owns one of the costliest chunks of real estate in the world, however, "mismanagement has led to its liabilities exceeding ₹10,000 crore". The LG tweeted a poster giving details of the financial condition of the urban body. He further invited suggestions to make the authority more "viable".

59.title: Only 3 states in India have at least one camera in each police station: Report
59.article_body: The India Justice Report, which analyses the police workforce in India, found that despite Supreme Court's order mandating CCTV cameras in all police stations, one in every three police stations does not have even a single camera. Odisha, Telangana and Puducherry were the only exceptions where all their police stations are equipped with at least one camera, the report said.

60.title: 'Kaali' director receives violent threats, says 'I don't feel safe anywhere'
60.article_body: 'Kaali' director Leena Manimekalai has alleged that she, her family and her collaborators have received thousands of threats of violence over her film's poster. "I do not feel safe anywhere at this moment," said Manimekalai. The alleged threats were sent from more than 200,000 accounts online, she said, calling it a "grand-scale mass lynching" by right-wing groups.

61.title: Canadian swimmer Harvey reveals she was drugged on last night of World C'ships
61.article_body: Canada's 22-year-old swimmer Mary-Sophie Harvey, who won bronze medal at the recently-concluded swimming World Championships in Budapest, revealed that she was drugged on the last night of the tournament. "There's this four-to-six-hour window where I can't recall a single thing," she wrote. Sharing pictures, she further revealed that she found a dozen of bruises on her body.

62.title: Was slapped by Rekha in 'Lajja', couldn't stop crying: Aarti Chabria
62.article_body: Actress Aarti Chabria said she couldn't stop crying after being slapped by actress Rekha in the film 'Lajja'. "I was [also] beaten up during [the film]," added Aarti. Discussing a scene from 'Awara Paagal Deewana' where she slaps Akshay Kumar's character, Aarti stated, "It was...an act...After I slap him, he immediately...raises his hand. That wasn't a part of the script."

63.title: Eknath Shinde officially takes charge as Maharashtra CM
63.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde formally took charge of his post at the state secretariat Mantralaya in Mumbai on Thursday. A 'puja' was held at the office of the CM before Shinde took charge. On Monday, the Shinde-led state government proved its majority in the Assembly as it surpassed the majority mark of 144.

64.title: Pune woman asked to pay electricity bill online, cheated of ₹10 lakh
64.article_body: A 53-year-old Pune-based woman allegedly lost over ₹10 lakh after a fraudster posing as a power company official asked her to pay her electricity bill online to avoid a power cut. The accused made the victim install 'Quick Support' and 'Any Desk' apps. She lost the money after she downloaded the apps and shared her phone screen with the accused.

65.title: Man rapes woman in Mumbai's hotel, threatens to leak private pics
65.article_body: A 38-year-old developer from Virar allegedly raped a 29-year-old woman in a five-star hotel in Mumbai, police said. The victim claimed the accused, who's her sister-in-law's husband, had promised to marry her and had also shot her private pictures and videos. She further alleged that he forced her to terminate her pregnancy and threatened to make her private pictures public.

66.title: Uterus transplants allow successful pregnancies in US women: Study
66.article_body: As many as 19 (58%) out of 33 women who underwent a uterus transplant in the US between 2016 and 2021 have delivered a total of 21 babies, researchers said. All the babies were delivered by Cesarean section, 14 months after the transplant on average. More than half of these babies were born after 36 weeks of gestation.

67.title: PM inaugurates 'Akshaya Patra' mid-day meal kitchen in Varanasi
67.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, on Thursday, inaugurated the 'Akshaya Patra' mid-day meal kitchen at the LT College in Varanasi, which can feed as many as 1 lakh students. As part of his visit, PM Modi will launch and lay the foundation stone for development projects worth ₹1,774 crore focused on improving infrastructure and ease of living, officials said.

68.title: Root is capable of breaking Sachin's Test tally record: Wasim Jaffer
68.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer has said England batter Joe Root can break Sachin Tendulkar's record of 15,921 runs in Test cricket. "Root can do it if he plays that long. He's only 31 years old...if he plays another five-six years...[then] he's capable of breaking the record," stated Jaffer. So far, Root has scored 10,458 runs in 121 Tests.

69.title: KCR didn't deliver promises, insulted PM with arrogance: BJP leader
69.article_body: BJP leader Gudur Narayana Reddy on Wednesday said that Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao failed in delivering promises and also accused him of insulting PM Narendra Modi with sheer arrogance. Reddy said that KCR has shown utter disrespect by not receiving PM Modi at the airport and for not taking part in the programmes being attended by the PM.

70.title: B2B marketplace Zetwerk promotes Ankit Fatehpuria as 5th Co-founder
70.article_body: B2B marketplace Zetwerk has promoted Ankit Fatehpuria, who joined the startup in 2019, as the fifth Co-founder of Zetwerk. Fatehpuria established the finance function of the company and also scaled multiple business verticals for it. Founded in 2018, Zetwerk acquired the unicorn status last year after raising $150 million in its Series E round at $1.33 billion valuation.

71.title: 19-year-old woman flung in air after being hit by a car in Hyd; video surfaces
71.article_body: A 19-year-old woman was critically injured after being hit by a car in Hyderabad's Rajendranagar. In a CCTV camera video of the incident, the woman is seen walking on the side of the road when a speeding car suddenly turned towards her and hit her. The woman was flung into the air before she fell down a few metre away.

72.title: Nakuul's mom says she doesn't like his hair in 'Bade...', actor shares chat
72.article_body: Television actor Nakuul Mehta took to Instagram to share a screenshot of his chat with his mother. In the chat, his mother told him that she does not like his hair in the television serial 'Bade Achhe Lagte Hain 2'. She asked why can't he go back to his original haircut. Mehta wrote he shared chat without his mother's consent.

73.title: Bengaluru residential unit sales jump 34% YoY in 1st quarter of 2022: Report
73.article_body: The Bengaluru residential real estate market saw its sales jump by 34% year-on-year (YoY) in the first quarter of 2022, according to global consultants Knight Frank's report. The residential real estate prices in Bengaluru also increased 7% YoY during this period, which is the highest in India. The rental levels increased by 4% in the city, as per the report.

74.title: Delhi Police arrests 2 men with demonetised currency worth ₹62 lakh
74.article_body: Delhi Police on Thursday said that they have arrested two men with demonetised currency worth ₹62 lakh. One of the accused informed the police that he purchased the demonetised currency from different people after paying ₹14 lakh in the new currency. The accused said that he had planned on selling the demonetised currency for ₹20 lakh.

75.title: DTC driver shot dead by bike-borne men in front of family in Delhi
75.article_body: A 45-year-old man was shot dead by two unidentified bike-borne men in front of his family in Delhi's Govindpuri, police said on Thursday. Around 8 pm on Wednesday, the deceased, along with his wife and eight-year-old son, were returning from a market when the two men opened fire at him, a senior police officer said.

76.title: Facebook accessed deleted Messenger app data of users: Fired employee
76.article_body: A fired Facebook employee has said a new protocol allowed members of the social network's Global Escalation Team "to circumvent Facebook's normal privacy protocols" by retrieving data from Messenger app "that users had chosen to delete". Brennan Lawson said he was fired for raising alarms about the protocol. Lawson has sued Facebook's parent Meta and is seeking over $3 million.

77.title: Sensex jumps 427 points to close at 54,178; Nifty ends above 16,000-mark
77.article_body: Indices rallied on Thursday with the BSE Sensex climbing 427 points (0.8%) to close over the 54,000-mark at 54,178 and the NSE Nifty50 closing above the 16,000-mark. Nifty50 rose 143 points or 0.89% and closed at 16,133. Titan Company, Tata Steel, L&T, ICICI Bank, IndusInd Bank, Kotak Bank and M&M were among the top gainers on Thursday.

78.title: Thanks for being my biggest supporter: Raina to Dhoni on his 41st b'day
78.article_body: Ex-India batter Suresh Raina took to Twitter to wish MS Dhoni on his 41st birthday, terming him as his "biggest" supporter and mentor in "every phase of life". "Happy Birthday to my big brother...May God bless you and your family with good health always. Much love to you Mahi bhai. Wishing you a great year ahead!" added Raina.

79.title: COVID vaccination mandatory to enter some public spaces in Beijing
79.article_body: People will have to show proof of COVID-19 vaccination before entering some public places, including gyms, cinemas, museums and libraries, in the Chinese capital Beijing from Monday. The list of public places requiring vaccination does not include restaurants and offices. Over 23 million people in Beijing have been vaccinated, a spokesperson for Beijing's Municipal Health Commission said.

80.title: Class 12 girl stabbed by neighbour after an argument in Delhi
80.article_body: A Class 12 girl was allegedly stabbed in the chest and stomach by her neighbour, a 17-year-old boy, after an argument broke out between them in West Delhi's Tilak Vihar area on Thursday. DCP (West) Ghanshyam Bansal said, "The victim and the accused...were friends for the past two-three years." Meanwhile, police have launched a manhunt to arrest the accused.

81.title: BJP demands ban on PFI after police arrest 4 party activists in T'gana
81.article_body: BJP's Telangana unit has urged the Union Home Ministry to ban the Popular Front of India (PFI) after four party activists were arrested in Nizamabad. "The PFI agenda confessed by...arrested suspects...is extremely unsettling and dangerous to the religious harmony...of this nation," said BJP's chief spokesperson K Krishna Sagar Rao, while calling it a "serious plot to destabilise the society''.

82.title: Delhi Police moves HC against Ishrat Jahan's bail in 2020 riots case
82.article_body: Delhi Police moved the Delhi High Court challenging the bail granted to former Congress councillor Ishrat Jahan in the larger conspiracy case of the 2020 Delhi riots. The trial court, which granted bail to Jahan, ignored the statements of protected witnesses, which "attributed a definite role" to her "not only in conspiracy but also in terror financing", Delhi Police stated.

83.title: Man returning home on bike with family from market shot dead in Delhi
83.article_body: A man returning home after purchasing food from a market with his wife and eight-year-old son was shot dead by two unknown assailants on Wednesday in southeast Delhi, police said. The family was near Deepalaya School when two persons fired at him near his right shoulder, police added. The man was rushed to a hospital where he was declared dead.

84.title: US exported 5 mn barrels of reserve oil to Asia, Europe last month amid record prices: Report
84.article_body: More than 5 million barrels of oil from the US Strategic Petroleum Reserve (SPR) were exported to Asia and Europe last month, as per reports. This comes despite the gasoline and diesel prices hitting record highs in the US. The latest exports follow three vessels that carried SPR crude to Europe in April helping replace Russian crude supplies.

85.title: He is a brilliant co-actor: Sanya Malhotra on working with Rajkummar Rao
85.article_body: Speaking about working with actor Rajkummar Rao in 'HIT: The First Case', actress Sanya Malhotra said, "When you're working with actors like Rajkummar Rao, it becomes more collaborative. You just have to follow their lead and react to what they're doing...So, I never felt anything was...challenging." She added that he's not only a good actor but a brilliant co-actor too.

86.title: B'luru reported over 5,000 COVID-19 cases in first 6 days of July
86.article_body: Bengaluru reported more than 5,000 COVID-19 cases in the first six days of July, i.e. from July 1 to 6, according to Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) figures. Notably, the city reported 1,053 new COVID-19 cases on Wednesday, while 985 people recovered from the disease in one day. The number of active cases in Bengaluru now stands at 6,056.

87.title: Rajesh Nambiar to no longer serve as Cognizant's digital business head
87.article_body: Cognizant has notified its shareholders that Rajesh Nambiar will no longer serve as the Executive Vice President and President of Digital Business and Technology, effective July 6. Nambiar will continue to serve as EVP, Chairman and Managing Director of Cognizant India. Cognizant has said that it will be simplifying its internal operating structure around practice areas and delivery operations.

88.title: Don't understand why PM Modi is not appealing for peace: Rajasthan CM
88.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said that if PM Narendra Modi would have appealed to the nation the incidents of violence would not have happened. "We are repeatedly appealing to PM Modi to give a message of peace and unity to nation as it will have an impact," he said. "Who is his advisor giving him such advice?" he questioned.

89.title: Indian-origin Rishi Sunak among leaders in race to be next UK PM
89.article_body: Amid reports that Boris Johnson will resign as the Prime Minister of UK, UK's former Finance Minister Rishi Sunak is among the leaders said to be in race to become the next PM. The Indian-origin leader, who is Infosys Co-founder NR Narayana Murthy's son-in-law had resigned citing Johnson's leadership. Liz Truss, Ben Wallace, Jeremy Hunt are among leaders in race.

90.title: He doesn't like us, we don't like him: Russia on UK PM's resignation reports
90.article_body: Russia reacted to reports that UK PM Boris Johnson was set to resign by saying that the news was of 'little concern' to the Kremlin. "He (Johnson) doesn't like us, we don't like him either," said Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov. He said Russia hoped that "more professional people who...make decisions through dialogue will come to power" in the UK.

91.title: The way Nadal competes each time is just brilliant to watch: Tendulkar
91.article_body: Reacting to Rafael Nadal's quarter-final win against Taylor Fritz at Wimbledon 2022, former India cricketer Sachin Tendulkar said it was an amazing game of tennis. "A super competitor who never ever gives up despite all adversities...The way you compete each time you're on the court is just brilliant to watch," tweeted Sachin. Nadal registered a five-set win despite abdominal pain.

92.title: Marriott hotel chain refuses to pay hackers who reportedly stole 20GB data
92.article_body: Marriott hotel chain has confirmed another data breach in which hackers claim to have stolen 20 gigabytes of sensitive data, including customer payment information. Marriott said the chain identified the incident before the hackers contacted the company and it refused to pay them. The firm said a Marriott hotel associate was tricked into providing access to their computer to hackers.

93.title: Had just ₹18 in my bank account, used to live on one Parle-G packet a day: Rajkummar Rao
93.article_body: Recalling the time when he moved to Mumbai, actor Rajkummar Rao said, "There were times when I lived on one Parle-G packet a day with just ₹18 in my bank account." He further said, "Luckily, I had friends from film school who helped. But I never had a Plan B. I always wanted to become an actor."

94.title: 18 Gir lions captured in single frame for the first time by wildlife photographer's wife
94.article_body: Preeti Pandya, wife of wildlife conservationist and wildlife photographer Bhushan Pandya, captured 18 Gir lions in one frame during the couple's visit to the Gir forest in Gujarat on World Environment Day last month. This is the highest number of Gir lions to be captured in a single frame in the history of the forest, reported The Indian Express.

95.title: Stop digging roads during rains or else we'll protest: MNS to PMC
95.article_body: The Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) has demanded that the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) should immediately stop digging city roads during the rainy season, warning that the party will resort to holding protests otherwise. "Despite the arrival of monsoon, PMC has dug up roads in many areas...causing traffic snarls and public inconvenience," MNS leader Babu Wagaskar said.

96.title: What protections will Apple's Lockdown Mode for its devices include?
96.article_body: In Apple's Lockdown Mode, most message attachment types other than images are blocked. Certain complex web technologies, like just-in-time JavaScript compilation, are disabled unless user excludes a trusted site from Lockdown Mode. Incoming invitations and service requests from Apple services, including FaceTime calls, are blocked if user has not previously sent the initiator a call or request.

97.title: Leader like no other: Virat Kohli wishes MS Dhoni on his 41st birthday
97.article_body: Team India batter Virat Kohli took to Twitter to wish former India captain MS Dhoni on his 41st birthday on Thursday. "A leader like no other. Thanks for everything you have done for Indian cricket. You became more like an elder brother for me. Nothing but love and respect always," wrote Kohli. Dhoni celebrated his birthday in London.

98.title: GrowthX secures $1.5 million in seed funding from 212 investors
98.article_body: Bengaluru-based edtech startup GrowthX has raised $1.5 million in a seed funding round, which saw participation from 212 investors. The startup said this was the largest-ever community-led seed round as 65% of the funds were raised from its own community members. Founders and executives from companies like Razorpay, Myntra, CRED, Google, Airbnb and Lenskart invested in the round.

99.title: Maha CM Eknath Shinde's locality water-logged amid heavy rain in Thane
99.article_body: Heavy overnight rain reportedly caused water-logging at various places in Thane, including Chief Minister Eknath Shinde's locality, on Thursday. Local firemen received a call around 6:15 am about flooding near Shinde's residence, following which civic personnel rushed to the spot and cleared the flood waters, an official said. Rains also caused trees to fall in some places, he added.

100.title: Man found dead in drain amid heavy rain in Maharashtra's Palghar
100.article_body: A man was found dead in a swollen drain in Maharashtra's Palghar district amid heavy rainfall. Police said it is suspected that the man, Rahul Vishwakarma, may have slipped into the drain and got washed away. The body was highly decomposed, police said, adding that it was sent to a government hospital for post-mortem.

101.title: Very heavy to extremely heavy rainfall warning in several states; IMD releases list
101.article_body: IMD has predicted isolated extremely heavy rainfall in Goa for five days and in Telangana, Karnataka, Gujarat and Uttarakhand between July 7 and 9. Very heavy rainfall is likely over Maharashtra, Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, Himachal Pradesh, Punjab, Haryana, Chandigarh and south Rajasthan between July 7 and 11. IMD issued red alert for Mumbai, Thane and Palghar for tomorrow.

102.title: India curbs exports of wheat flour & related products from July 12
102.article_body: India has restricted the export of wheat flour (atta) and other related products like maida, semolina (rava) etc, making it mandatory for all such exporters to seek prior permission for the exports. A Directorate General of Foreign Trade notification said that the restrictions will come into effect from July 12. India had earlier banned wheat exports amid a heatwave.

103.title: Aarey protest not just to protect people but also the city: Cong's Aslam
103.article_body: Speaking on protest against Aarey metro car shed, Congress' Aslam Shaikh said that the protest isn't only to protect people's houses but also the city. "In three days of rains, we've witnessed [Mumbai] submerge...Forest area should be left the way it is," Shaikh added. This comes after the newly-formed Maharashtra government approved decision to relocate car shed to Aarey colony.

104.title: Pune Cantonment Board is in a precarious financial condition: New CEO
104.article_body: Pune Cantonment Board's new CEO Subrat Pal has expressed concerns over financial crunch being faced by the board. "The board is in a precarious financial condition," he said, adding that giving salaries to the staff would also be difficult if the Centre doesn't provide enough funds in next two months. The board's monthly expenditure is estimated to be ₹6 crore.

105.title: Kangana recalls her Koffee with Karan episode, says 'It was a surgical strike'
105.article_body: Kangana Ranaut took a veiled dig at Karan Johar as he gears for the premiere of 'Koffee With Karan 7'. Ahead of the episode's release, Kangana took to Instagram Stories and wrote, "Good luck to papa jo...but what about this episode oh sorry!!! surgical strike, ghar mein ghusss ke mara tha na, my episode is his most popular episode."

106.title: Man takes Mumbai woman to Bihar after kidnapping her; rapes her
106.article_body: Police have arrested a 27-year-old man for allegedly kidnapping and taking a 25-year-old Mumbai-based woman to Bihar and raping her. He kidnapped her in January 2022 when she took a train to visit North India. According to a police officer, a relative of the accused, identified as Vaisaid Nisar, was stalking the woman online and in person since November 2021.

107.title: You've to go down to hell to beat him: Taylor Fritz after loss vs Nadal
107.article_body: Following his defeat against Rafael Nadal in the quarter-finals of Wimbledon 2022, American tennis player Taylor Fritz said, "I still believe...[Nadal] can be beaten. Only, you have to go down to hell to achieve it." "This loss is the one that hurts the most...When the match was over, I felt like crying...[I've] never felt this after a loss," added Fritz.

108.title: IIT Madras develops AI tool that can predict cancer-causing genes
108.article_body: Researchers at IIT Madras have developed an artificial intelligence tool that is capable of predicting cancer-causing genes in an individual. The tool called 'PIVOT' can help in devising personalised cancer treatments, the institute said. Researchers have currently created AI prediction models for three types of cancer but they are planning to build models for more cancer types.

109.title: Security issues in Pacific should be solved locally: New Zealand PM
109.article_body: New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern on Thursday said that security challenges in the Pacific region need to be resolved locally. She also said that regional architecture such as the Pacific Islands Forum is critical in resolving local problems. Her comments come amid growing concerns in New Zealand, Australia and the US about China's growing influence in the region.

110.title: Will start centre to train underprivileged aspiring actors for free: Sood
110.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood said he'll start a centre where aspiring actors, technicians from underprivileged backgrounds will be trained for free. "[I've] seen people who come to Mumbai and cannot survive...[I want to give them] access...that a newcomer cannot get...When I came to Mumbai, I didn't have anybody to guide me...There are sharks who take advantage of the innocent," added Sood.

111.title: Had ₹1500 in my account, was like 'Can't afford to do sh*t': Anurag's daughter
111.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap's daughter Aaliyah Kashyap recalled having ₹1500 in her account after moving out. "I was like literally, 'Can't afford to do sh*t'...I literally had to tell my mom to send me food at home because I couldn't afford to even get groceries for three days. It was not a fun time, would never do that again," she added.

112.title: Alia & I've been talking about having kids from the first day we met: Ranbir
112.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor opened up about having a baby with his wife, actress Alia Bhatt. Ranbir said that he and Alia have been talking about having kids from the first day they met and fell in love and revealed that they've always wanted children. "To start a new chapter in life...I am extremely excited about that...can't wait," he added.

113.title: 3 more PFI activists arrested in Nizamabad, booked under UAPA
113.article_body: The Nizamabad Police in Telangana arrested three PFI activists on charges of allegedly attempting to create religious animosity and training youngsters in usage of lethal weapons. They were booked under UAPA and other sections of IPC. This comes after a PFI activist was arrested for training youth in martial arts in Nizamabad.

114.title: Cong blames BJP after B'luru ranked 'least liveable' city in India
114.article_body: Congress MLA Ramalinga Reddy has blamed the BJP government in Karnataka after Bengaluru was ranked the 'least liveable' city in India. He said, "[Bengaluru] has lost the ranking due to the poor quality of infrastructure, roads...For all this...BJP...[is] the reason." Bengaluru has been ranked 146 (score 54.4), the least among five Indian cities which featured on Global Liveability Index 2022.

115.title: Fake number of BBMP chief circulates online; complaint filed
115.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner Tushar Giri Nath said that a fake number has been circulating in his name online. "Please note that 7076522681 isn't my number," Nath said, adding that some fraudster is using this number to mislead the public and officials. He also said that he has filed a complaint with Karnataka CID in this regard.

116.title: Taliban digs out Toyota car used by its former leader to escape US invasion
116.article_body: Taliban militants in Afghanistan dug out a Toyota car used by their former leader Mullah Omar to escape being targeted by US forces after the 9/11 attacks in 2001. The white Toyota Corolla was buried in a village garden in Zabul province. "It is still in good condition, only its front is a bit damaged," Taliban militant Rahmatullah Hammad said.

117.title: Biden speaks with wife of US basketball player detained in Russia
117.article_body: US President Joe Biden spoke with the wife of basketball player Brittney Griner, who's being detained in Russia on drug charges, the White House said. Biden assured Cherelle Griner that he's working to secure Brittney's release "as soon as possible". This comes after Brittney, in a handwritten letter to Biden, said that she fears she'll be detained in Russia indefinitely.

118.title: Was like being in the middle of a war zone: Moeen on 2022 CL final chaos
118.article_body: Sharing his experience at France's Stade de France before the 2022 Champions League final between Liverpool and Real Madrid, English cricketer Moeen Ali said, "It was...like being in the middle of a war zone." "We had...kids...and they were crying, it was horrible...I didn't feel safe...Pepper spray, crushing, police with shields, fights...I just wanted to get home," added Moeen.

119.title: PMPML to install boom barriers at 148 junctions on BRTS routes
119.article_body: The Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Ltd (PMPML) has decided to install 148 automatic boom barriers on Bus Rapid Transit System (BRTS) routes in the city. "PMPML hopes to bring a check on private vehicles entering dedicated BRTS lanes by installing automatic boom barriers...They will be operated on a number plate recognition-based access control and monitoring system," an official said.

120.title: JNU not a place to pursue political aspirations: VC
120.article_body: Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) Vice Chancellor Santishree Dhulipudi Pandit on Wednesday said that JNU is not a place for pursuing political aspirations. "Language is a sensitive issue, pushing a particular language too hard could lead to regionalism," she added. She claimed that 90% of JNU students are apolitical and only 10% are "troublemakers".

121.title: FIR against ex-Kerala minister Saji Cherian over anti-Constitution remarks
121.article_body: An FIR was lodged on Thursday at Keezhvaipur Police Station against former Kerala Culture Minister Saji Cherian over anti-Constitution remarks. Cherian on Wednesday resigned from the state Cabinet amid protests over his remarks. The Constitution endorses exploitation and loot of common people, he had said. "The news that I criticised the Constitution is twisted," Cherian later said.

122.title: Mohammed Zubair approaches Supreme Court against UP Police FIR
122.article_body: Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair has moved the Supreme Court for quashing of a hate speech FIR registered against him in Uttar Pradesh's Sitapur. He has also moved the court for pre-arrest bail. Zubair's lawyer Colin Gonsalves has approached the apex court against the Allahabad High Court's decision to not quash the FIR against him on June 13.

123.title: 5 pet puppies of 69-yr-old woman killed by poisoning in Mumbai
123.article_body: Five pet puppies belonging to a 69-year-old woman were allegedly killed by poisoning in Mumbai's Kandivali. The woman said that her puppies suddenly fell ill and died with foam and blood coming out of their mouths. She suspects that her 35-year-old neighbour, who frequently used to pick fights with her over the pets, might have killed the dogs.

124.title: Twitter should check tweets by perverted mentality people: MP minister
124.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra has said he will write to Twitter on tweets hurting religious sentiments, adding, "Twitter should check tweets posted by people having perverted mentality, like...'Kaali' film director, Leena Manimekalai." He will also write to the central government to issue a lookout circular against Manimekalai "as whatever she is doing appears to be deliberate".

125.title: Kohli not a certainty in India's T20I side: Wasim Jaffer
125.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said Virat Kohli's form will be "taken into consideration" in the upcoming T20Is against England. "Kohli has not been in the best of forms...I don't think he'll be a certainty because so many young players have done so well," stated Jaffer. Kohli will be available for the second and third T20I against England.

126.title: My political tenure not yet completed: Naqvi after resigning as Union Minister
126.article_body: A day after resigning as the Union Cabinet Minister of Minority Affairs, Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi on Thursday said that his political and social tenure has not yet been completed. “I understand that my tenure in Rajya Sabha has been completed...I will continue to work with dedication and concern for society,” he added.

127.title: Siddaramaiah's govt was unresponsive to many scams: K'taka CM Bommai
127.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Wednesday said the government led by Congress leader Siddaramaiah was unresponsive to many scams related to recruitment tests and PU (pre-university) exams. "It was a government that covered up many such scams," Bommai added. The scam related to PU exams, involving ₹18 crore, was buried without taking any action against the culprits, Bommai alleged.

128.title: BJP sending army of trolls to spread false info about SC judges: Cong
128.article_body: The Congress accused BJP of promoting personal attacks on Supreme Court judges and making campaigns to pressurise and influence free decision-making of the judiciary. "An army of trolls is sent out by BJP to fabricate and disseminate false information about the judges and altered photos are published to suggest a false closeness with Congress leaders," party spokesperson Abhishek Singhvi said.

129.title: Gita Gopinath becomes the only woman to feature on the wall of former IMF Chief Economists
129.article_body: Gita Gopinath, the First Deputy Managing Director at the IMF, has become the first woman whose portrait was featured on the wall of former Chief Economists of the IMF. "Breaking the trend...I joined the wall of former Chief Economists of the IMF," tweeted Gopinath sharing two photos. She served as the Chief Economist of the Fund from 2019 to 2022.

130.title: ALLEN sues 20 ex-educators for alleged breach of contract: Report
130.article_body: ALLEN Career Institute has sued 20 of its former educators for alleged breach of employee agreements, media reports said. The platform alleged that the teachers breached the service agreement by not serving a four-month notice period and not completing their service tenure. However, a Jaipur court dismissed plea against five educators who argued the clauses were against basic employees' rights.

131.title: Mentally unstable man beats 62-yr-old priest to death in Delhi
131.article_body: A mentally unstable man allegedly thrashed a 62-year-old priest to death in Delhi's Sonia Vihar, police said on Thursday. The accused, identified as Sonu Bhatt, was reportedly assaulted by locals following the incident and is currently in a hospital. After preliminary investigation, police found that Bhatt is not in a "healthy state of mind" and was known to the deceased.

132.title: Go now: New UK Finance Minister as he asks PM Johnson to resign
132.article_body: Britain's new Finance Minister Nadhim Zahawi has told Boris Johnson to resign, less than 48 hours after the PM promoted him to the job. "He is now undermining the incredible achievements of this government. The country deserves a government that is not only stable, but which acts with integrity," Zahawi said. Over 50 MPs have resigned form Johnson's government.

133.title: Actor Sreejith Ravi arrested for allegedly flashing his genitals at 2 minor girls
133.article_body: Actor Sreejith Ravi, who appears in Malayalam and Tamil films, has been arrested for allegedly flashing his genitals at two minor girls at a park in Ayyanthole in Kerala's Thrissur. The Thrissur West Police has registered a case under POCSO Act against him. Following the complaint by the girls, CCTV footage examined by the police confirmed the man was Sreejith.

134.title: Biden to revoke Afghanistan’s designation as major non-NATO ally
134.article_body: US President Joe Biden in a letter to Congress on Wednesday said that he intends to rescind the designation of Afghanistan as a major non-NATO ally. Afghanistan was given the status in 2012. The move comes after the Taliban took control of Afghanistan last year after the US withdrew its troops from the country following 20 years of war.

135.title: 'Kaali' director posts pic of people dressed as God, Goddess smoking amid poster issue
135.article_body: Amid controversy over the poster of her movie 'Kaali', director Leena Manimekalai posted a picture showing people dressed as God and Goddess smoking. Meanwhile, microblogging site Twitter has removed the July 2 tweet of the filmmaker which depicted an actress dressed as Goddess Kaali smoking.

136.title: Won't stop work on Eastern Rajasthan Canal Project: CM Ashok Gehlot
136.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Wednesday said his government won't stop work on the Eastern Rajasthan Canal Project (ERCP). His comments came after Jal Shakti Ministry asked Rajasthan government to hold the project citing "lack of consent on interstate issues". "Water is [of] the state...the catchment area is ours...who're you to tell us to stop the project?" Gehlot further said.

137.title: Why not call 3rd one to shoot too: Big B on Ajay, Rohit's 'Bol Bachchan' pic
137.article_body: As 'Bol Bachchan' completed ten years, actor Ajay Devgn shared a picture of himself with filmmaker Rohit Shetty. Actor Amitabh Bachchan, who was seen in the film's title song, commented on the post saying, "Oh man, why won't you call the third one to shoot as well." The film also featured actor Abhishek Bachchan and actresses Asin and Prachi Desai.

138.title: EAM Jaishankar holds 1-hour meet with China's Foreign Minister on border issues in Bali
138.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar met China's Foreign Minister Wang Yi in Bali on the sidelines of G-20 Foreign Ministers' Meeting. Jaishankar tweeted, "Discussion lasted one hour. Focused on specific outstanding issues in our bilateral relationship pertaining to the border situation." The EAM added that they also discussed other matters including students and flights.

139.title: More than 50 Members of Parliament quit UK PM's government in less than 48 hours
139.article_body: More than 50 Members of Parliament have quit UK PM Boris Johnson's government in less than 48 hours. Johnson sacked Michael Gove from his cabinet post on Wednesday night after the leader told the PM to resign. Among those who have stepped down are Sajid Javid who was serving as Health Secretary and Finance Minister Rishi Sunak.

140.title: Fintech firms, NBFCs funded by Chinese money generated ₹950-cr slush funds in India: ED
140.article_body: Several fintech companies and non-banking financial companies (NBFCs) backed by Chinese funds generated proceeds of crime worth nearly ₹950 crore by indulging in predatory lending activities and violating RBI guidelines in India, the ED said. The ED has mounted a crackdown on such companies who, it said, were "operating on the basis of instructions from Chinese, Hong Kong persons".

141.title: Pant has improved remarkably as a keeper like MS Dhoni did: Manjrekar
141.article_body: Ex-India batter Sanjay Manjrekar said he was earlier sceptical about Rishabh Pant's ability as a keeper in English conditions, but termed his keeping during the Tests against England as "strikingly brilliant". "Pant has taken the job very seriously and his improvement has...been remarkable, just like [Dhoni's was]...The big news for India is the growth of Pant, the wicketkeeper," added Manjrekar.

142.title: Govt launches indigenously made motor & controller tech for e-rickshaws
142.article_body: The government has launched an indigenous, efficient, affordable and certified BLDC motor and smart controller technology for e-rickshaws developed by IIT Kharagpur. The technology was developed under the electronics and IT ministry's programme for the indigenous development of electric vehicle subsystems. It was transferred to Brushless Motor India for commercial production.

143.title: Bagga sends flowers to CM Mann on getting married, shares screenshot
143.article_body: BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga sent flower bouquet to Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on his wedding. He posted the screenshot of his order worth ₹568 on his Twitter handle and wrote, "Sent flowers and Best wishes message to Bhagwant Mann ji on his wedding." Bagga had earlier criticised CM Mann for spending on advertisements of Punjab government's paperless budget.

144.title: Real consumers of Skin Foods Glow Mix feature with Malaika Arora: Kapiva
144.article_body: Kapiva's Glow Mix consumers Aishwarya & Krishna featured alongside Malaika on ELLE, showcasing their confidence from healthy glowing skin and emphasizing that skin needs inner nutrition beyond creams & serums. Malaika's secret for healthy skin is 10+ Ayurvedic herbs in Glow Mix that boost collagen production, naturally leading to healthy, glowing, clearer skin that boosts confidence, said Kapiva.

145.title: When you have big squad, it's difficult to determine the XI: Zaheer
145.article_body: Ahead of India's first T20I against England, ex-India pacer Zaheer Khan has said India should begin selecting players for the T20 World Cup in Australia later this year. "When you have such a big squad, it becomes difficult to determine which players should play," stated Zaheer. "The team [management] have to see what sort of combination they finalise," he added.

146.title: WHO calls emergency meeting as global monkeypox cases cross 6,000
146.article_body: The World Health Organization said that over 6,000 cases of monkeypox have now been reported from 58 countries, with over 80% of the cases in Europe. The agency will reconvene a meeting of the emergency committee "in the week of July 18 or sooner" to reassess whether the outbreak constitutes a public health emergency, WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said.

147.title: 66 Shiv Sena corporators from Thane join Maha CM Shinde's camp
147.article_body: As many as 66 Shiv Sena corporators from Thane, led by former mayor Naresh Muske, visited Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde's official residence at Nandanvan and joined his camp. Former Amravati Lok Sabha MP, Anandrao Vithoba Adsul, also resigned as a Sena leader. Shiv Sena is currently divided into two camps, one led by Uddhav Thackeray and the other by Shinde.

148.title: They told me I needed to retire vs Fritz, don't know if I'll play semis: Nadal
148.article_body: Rafael Nadal has revealed that his team asked him to retire during his quarter-final win against Taylor Fritz due to his abdominal injury. "It's something that I hate to do. So, I just kept trying," he added. However, on being asked about his chances of playing the semi-final against Nick Kyrgios, Nadal said, "I can't give you a clear answer."

149.title: Murmu as President a matter of pride for country: Maha CM Eknath Shinde
149.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde said tribal community member Droupadi Murmu's nomination for the Presidential election is a matter of pride for our country. "PM Modi has given an opportunity to Murmu to become the...President. It's a matter of pride and honour," he said. "I am also proud that a tribal community member has been nominated for the post," he added.

150.title: I worry for India, they don't have bowling options: Vaughan on T20 WC
150.article_body: Talking about the upcoming T20 World Cup 2022, ex-England captain Michael Vaughan said he is "worried" about India not having enough bowling options. "It is about trying to find players in the top five, who can offer you overs. Maybe Hardik Pandya bats in the top five," added Vaughan. "They have got to find a better mechanism," he stated.

151.title: Sky turns green in several US' cities after powerful storm, pics go viral
151.article_body: Sky over several cities in US' states of South Dakota, Nebraska and Iowa turned green following a powerful storm. The US' National Weather Service (NWS) said the storm was a derecho. It brought powerful winds, with speeds of around 159 kmph in some areas. "Have never seen something like that," a Twitter user wrote sharing a picture of green sky.

152.title: Twitter removes director Leena's Kaali poster tweet showing goddess smoking; she responds
152.article_body: Twitter has removed filmmaker Leena Manimekalai's 'Kaali' movie poster tweet which showed the goddess smoking. Manimekalai tweeted, "This is hilarious. Will Twitter India withhold the tweets of the 200000 hate mongers?! These lowlife trolls tweeted and spread the very same poster that they find objectionable." She added Kaali is the goddess of death and cannot be lynched, raped or destroyed.

153.title: Woman, 3 lawyers extort money after lodging fake rape case in Agra, arrested
153.article_body: Agra Police in UP arrested a woman and three lawyers allegedly involved in extorting money by lodging a fake rape case against a man. The woman alleged that she was raped by the man at a hotel. "The woman complainant and three lawyers were arrested along with cash of ₹3.75 lakh," an official said.

154.title: Over 90 ill due to diarrhoea outbreak in Lucknow
154.article_body: More than 90 people have fallen ill after a diarrhoea outbreak in Lucknow's Aliganj allegedly due to contaminated water supply in the area. While eight people have been admitted to hospital due to nausea and loose motions, a one-year-old child reportedly died due to the disease. "We took samples of...water...prima facie it appears to be contaminated," a medical officer said.

155.title: Level 2 fire breaks out in Mumbai supermarket, 12 fire tenders rushed
155.article_body: A level two fire broke out in Haiko Supermarket in Hiranandani Powai area of Mumbai. News agency ANI reported that 12 fire tenders were rushed to the spot. Reports also said that no one has been reported trapped in the building so far. No injuries or casualties have been reported.

156.title: Policeman removed from post over objectionable comments against UP CM
156.article_body: A station house officer (SHO) of Asandra Police Station in Uttar Pradesh's Barabanki has been removed from his post for allegedly making objectionable comments against CM Yogi Adityanath. BJP district president Shashank Kushumesh received a video from a journalist wherein the SHO was purportedly making comments against CM Yogi while talking to someone in his office room.

157.title: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann gets married to Dr Gurpreet Kaur, first pic surfaces
157.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Thursday got married to Dr Gurpreet Kaur in a private ceremony, which was also attended by Delhi CM and AAP Convenor Arvind Kejriwal. Mann was earlier married to Inderpreet Kaur, with whom he got divorced in 2015. He has two children from his first marriage.

158.title: Islamic State claims responsibility for prison attack in Nigeria
158.article_body: Islamic State militant group has claimed responsibility for attacking a prison in Nigeria's capital Abuja on Tuesday. A total of 879 inmates had fled following the attack. Around 443 are still at large and the rest have been recaptured, the prison service said. Nigeria's President Muhammadu Buhari has questioned the prison's intelligence system and demanded a report on the attack.

159.title: CAs who helped Chinese nationals establish Vivo-linked firm under probe: Report
159.article_body: Indian agencies are now probing the local support that two Chinese nationals got in establishing a company which projected itself as a subsidiary of Vivo, The Economic Times reported citing sources. Two chartered accountants and a company secretary are under probe in the matter. Forged documents, certified by the three, were allegedly used to register Grand Prospect International Communication.

160.title: 12-year-old girl sexually harassed in Gurugram, accused arrested
160.article_body: A 24-year-old man was arrested in Gurugram for allegedly sexually harassing a 12-year-old girl. "Earlier, I took the matter to the panchayat where Sanjay (accused) was asked [not to do] such a thing again," the victim's father said. However, the accused harassed the girl again on Tuesday, her father claimed, following which he filed a complaint with the police.

161.title: Other Muslims are Assamese too: Assam CM on indigenous status to 5 Muslim communities
161.article_body: After Assam cabinet granted indigenous status to five Assamese-speaking Muslim communities, Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said other Muslims are Assamese too and shouldn't worry. "They are Goria, Moriya, Deshi, Julah and Syed," state Health Minister Keshab Mahanta said earlier. This will ensure their development in health, education, skill development and women empowerment, Sarma said.

162.title: Over 44,000 challans issued under bus lane enforcement drive in Delhi
162.article_body: Delhi government's transport department has challaned a total of 44,594 people over the last two months under its bus lane enforcement drive. According to the department, till July 4, 1,591 bus drivers were challaned for lane violations, whereas 43,003 challans were issued to private vehicle owners for parking in bus lanes. The drive was launched on April 1 this year.

163.title: Man slits woman's throat for refusing sexual advances in Delhi
163.article_body: A 25-year-old man was arrested after he allegedly slit a 22-year-old woman's throat for refusing his sexual advances in Delhi's Gandhi Nagar area, police said. "Her 'mangal sutra' was found sunk on her throat and blood was oozing from there," police added. The accused, identified as Maan Singh, is a resident of Uttar Pradesh's Kaushambi, police stated.

164.title: UK jeweller paid $7.5 mn ransom in Bitcoin to Russian hackers: Report
164.article_body: Luxury British jeweller Graff Diamonds paid $7.5 million ransom in Bitcoin to a group of Russian hackers after it leaked some of its customers' data and threatened to leak more, Bloomberg reported. Graff has now sued its insurance firm, alleging it has denied to pay for the losses incurred due to the extortion. The data leak happened in September 2021.

165.title: England are desperate for pacer who can bowl 95 mph like Umran: Gough
165.article_body: Former England pacer Darren Gough said England are desperate for a pacer who can bowl at a speed of 95 mph like India's Umran Malik. Gough added that Malik should be picked by India in their lineups for the upcoming T20I series against England. "We've got Mark Wood who is injured...we've got Archer who is [also] injured," stated Gough.

166.title: I attempted suicide when I was 21 or 22, jumped in Ganga river: Kailash Kher
166.article_body: Singer Kailash Kher revealed he attempted suicide when he was 21 or 22. "I felt I was useless to the world and not supposed to be born in this time and [plastic] world," he said. Kailash added, "I jumped in the Ganga river...someone saved me...At the time I thought I must be such a useless man...I even failed in this."

167.title: Actress Bevin Prince's husband William Friend dies at 33 after being struck by lightning
167.article_body: Actress Bevin Prince's husband William Friend passed away aged 33 after being struck by lightning on a boat near Masonboro Island in North Carolina in the US. Emergency responders tried to resuscitate him, but he was pronounced dead in the ambulance. William was the CEO of multi-platform digital media company Bisnow.

168.title: Zomato responds after pic shows price difference between Zomato online & offline bills
168.article_body: Zomato has responded after a LinkedIn user made a comparison of Zomato online and offline food bills of the same order. Zomato responded to the user saying it has no control over the prices set by its partner restaurants. "That said, we have conveyed your feedback to the restaurant partner and have requested them to look into this," Zomato added.

169.title: Not a bad option at all: Gavaskar on Pant as opener in white-ball cricket
169.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said Team India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant can be "equally destructive" as an opener in white-ball cricket. "Not a bad option at all...[as opener] Pant will have a few deliveries to get used to the pace and movement...That can actually work in India's favour," explained Gavaskar. Pant scored a century and a fifty in Edgbaston Test.

170.title: Kejriwal wishes Mann on his marriage, says he is embarking on new journey
170.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal reached Punjab's Mohali on Thursday morning to take part in Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's wedding ceremony and congratulated Mann for his "new journey". "He is embarking on a new journey today, I wish him a happy married life," Kejriwal said. Mann will get married to Dr Gurpreet Kaur in a private ceremony in Chandigarh.

171.title: TMC's Mahua posts 'Be careful, Mahua!' poem by citizen after FIR over Goddess Kali remark
171.article_body: TMC MP Mahua Moitra took to Twitter to share a poem 'Be careful, Mahua!' reportedly written for her by a citizen of India after FIRs were filed against her in West Bengal and Madhya Pradesh over her remarks on Goddess Kali. Moitra had said that Goddess Kali ate meat and accepted alcohol. TMC had condemned Moitra's remarks.

172.title: Sanjay said 'Tell me what to do', told me 'show me how to do scene': Karan
172.article_body: 'Shamshera' director Karan Malhotra, while speaking about working with actor Sanjay Dutt again, said that he came to the set and said, "Tell me what to do." "I told him this is what scene is...Then he'd ask me, 'Show me how to do it once'. I would play whole part...and he would look at me with childlike excitement," he added.

173.title: Decomposed body of man found in apartment of Thane's housing society
173.article_body: The decomposed body of a 47-year-old man was found inside an apartment in a Thane-based housing society, the police said. The incident came to light after the neighbour of the man complained to local firemen about foul smell from the house.
