The firemen rushed to the spot and found the decomposed body of the man, Satishkumar Krishna Pillai, lying inside.

174.title: Chemist arrested for illegal sale of abortion kits in Gurugram
174.article_body: A chemist was arrested in Gurugram's Sohna on Tuesday for allegedly selling medical kits for abortion illegally. According to police, the accused identified as Nafiz was caught with five medical termination of pregnancy (MTP) kits. He would sell them without a bill and prescription. These kits were allegedly used to abort the female foetus in the region, police said.

175.title: LazyPay temporarily suspends 'Buy Now, Pay Later' service after RBI directive
175.article_body: PayU-owned startup LazyPay has temporarily suspended its 'Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL)' service named LazyPlus UPI. The suspension comes a month after RBI stated that non-bank wallets and pre-paid cards cannot extend credit lines via their products to customers. Through LazyPlus UPI, which was launched in 2020, the startup was offering a credit line of up to ₹1 lakh.

176.title: Hate cannot be countered through hate: Jamiat chief Mahmood Madani
176.article_body: Speaking about incidents of violence in the country following row over remarks against Prophet Muhammad, Muslim organisation Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind's chief Maulana Mahmood Asad Madani said that hate cannot be countered through hate. "The circumstances prevailing in the country, if it continues like this, then the loss will be of the country, not of any particular religion or community," he added.

177.title: Hyd civic body deploys 2,375 staffers to contain vector-borne diseases
177.article_body: In order to tackle the spread of vector-borne diseases, Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has decided to deploy 2,375 of its staff members. GHMC has also allotted two portable fogging machines to every ward and two vehicle-mounted fogging machines to every circle. Notably, anti-larval operations are being carried out with 642 teams on a weekly basis in Hyderabad.

178.title: BMC to build 100 artificial lakes for Ganesh visarjan in Mumbai: Report
178.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is reportedly planning to build 100 artificial lakes across Mumbai for Ganesh visarjan. Officials of all 24 administrative wards have been asked to make arrangements for three to four lakes in each ward, reports added. This comes after BMC ordered citizens to immerse Ganesh idols made of Plaster of Paris (PoP) only in artificial lakes.

179.title: US July 4 parade gunman considered carrying out 2nd attack: Police
179.article_body: The 21-year-old man accused of opening fire on a US Independence Day parade and killing seven people admitted he considered attacking another July 4 event while on the run, police said. Indications are that Robert Crimo didn't carry out the attack because "he hadn't put enough...research into it", they added. Reportedly, he'd approximately 60 rounds of ammunition in his car.

180.title: Time will tell whether Edgbaston Test defeat will affect T20Is, ODIs: Rohit
180.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma, on being asked whether the Edgbaston Test defeat will have any impact on the white-ball series against England, said, "It's a different format and a different set of players who are going to take the field for us." He added, "England [are] also a different side...time will tell whether that result has impacted our preparation."

181.title: The manner in which India lost the 5th Test has to be a shock: Agarkar
181.article_body: Ajit Agarkar said England's win by seven wickets having been handed a 378-run target in the fifth Test against India, has to be a "shock" for the latter. Agarkar added India certainly had to make England work harder, adding they chased down the target quite easily. Both teams will face off in the first T20I of their three-match series today.

182.title: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's pic in his wedding attire shared by Raghav Chadha
182.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann's picture in his wedding attire was shared by AAP leader Raghav Chadha on Twitter. Earlier, Chadha had said, "Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal will be arriving shortly with his family. I have come here with my mother. I wholeheartedly congratulate Bhagwant Mann and his family." Mann will tie the knot with Dr Gurpreet Kaur today.

183.title: Govt releases 2nd list of 23 beneficiaries under PLI scheme for drones
183.article_body: The government has released the second provisional list of 23 beneficiaries under the PLI Scheme of Drones and Drone Components. This list included Adani-Elbit, Garuda Aerospace, Throttle Aerospace Systems and Absolute Composites, among others. The combined annual sales turnover of the listed companies has increased from ₹88 crore in FY 2020-21 to ₹319 crore (unaudited) in FY 2021-22.

184.title: FIR against AAP MLA for assaulting 2 men over sewage complaint
184.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA Akhilesh Pati Tripathi was booked for allegedly assaulting two men in Delhi's Ashok Vihar area. One of the victims, Guddu Halwai, claimed that he met the AAP lawmaker during a function and complained about sewage problems in the area which angered the MLA who reportedly hit him on his head with a piece of brick.

185.title: Journalist says Raghav was thought as most eligible AAP bachelor, he replies
185.article_body: After a journalist tweeted that people thought Raghav Chadha was the most eligible bachelor in AAP ahead of Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's wedding, Chadha responded, saying, "The turn of the younger ones comes only after the elder." Chadha also wrote, "Best wishes to my vadde veer Mann Saab and Dr Gurpreet Kaur for a happy and blessed married life."

186.title: Idea of punishing a nuclear power like us poses threat to existence of humanity: Russia
186.article_body: The Deputy Chairman of the Russian Security Council, Dmitry Medvedev, has commented on attempts by the West to punish Russia for the war in Ukraine. Medvedev said, "The idea of punishing a country that has one of the largest nuclear potentials is absurd. And potentially poses a threat to the existence of humanity."

187.title: Jordanian Princess Iman gets engaged to New York-based financier Thermiotis, pic surfaces
187.article_body: Jordanian Princess Iman bint Abdullah II got engaged to New York-based financier Jameel Alexander Thermiotis on Tuesday. Princess Iman, who is 25 years old, is the eldest daughter of Queen Rania and King Abdullah II of Jordan. Meanwhile, Thermiotis was born in Venezuela's Caracas in 1994 and is of Greek descent.

188.title: Everything I tweet is my personal opinion, I don't have any other kind: Tharoor
188.article_body: Congress' Shashi Tharoor said everything he tweets is his personal opinion. "I don't have any other kind," he tweeted. This comes after he said he was taken aback by "attack" on TMC's Mahua Moitra over her remark on goddess Kaali. Meanwhile, Congress' Ragini Nayak said, "Shashi Tharoorji expresses his personal opinions assertively and has done same on this issue too."

189.title: FIR against those sacrificing cattle for Bakri Eid: K'taka Minister
189.article_body: Karnataka Animal Husbandry Minister Prabhu Bhamla Chavan has urged people to not slaughter cattle for Bakri Eid  and warned stern action against offenders. "If cow slaughter is found, an FIR will be registered in the local police station...and strict action will be taken against the culprits," Chavan said. A task force has been appointed in Bengaluru to prevent cow slaughter.

190.title: Samsung Electronics forecasts highest Q2 operating profit since 2018
190.article_body: Samsung Electronics posted its preliminary earnings report for the second quarter on Thursday, forecasting highest Q2 operating profit since 2018. The South Korea-based company's profit in Q2 rose to around $10.73 billion, up from around $9.63 billion in the same quarter last year, as per estimates. Its sales rose to around $59.14 billion, the report estimated.

191.title: Pune man promised dating membership with 'sexual services', loses ₹18 lakh
191.article_body: A man, who was contacted by a woman, under pretext of offering him a "dating membership", which she claimed provided "sexual services by women", lost ₹18 lakh after he agreed to be a member. The woman allegedly asked the man to pay money for various purposes and also threatened to lodge a criminal case against him.

192.title: Red alert issued for several Maha areas amid heavy rains; Mumbai on orange alert
192.article_body: Amid heavy rains lashing Maharashtra, the India Meteorological Department has issued a red alert for Raigad, Ratnagiri, Kolhapur and Sindhudurg till July 9. Apart from that, Palghar, Pune and Satara are on red alert till July 8. News agency ANI reported that Mumbai and Thane are on orange alert till July 10.

193.title: I want us to play in same fashion, to be really aggressive: Buttler
193.article_body: England's newly appointed white-ball captain Jos Buttler has said their recent success in Test cricket is a reminder of the way they want to play cricket as well. "I want us to play in exactly the same fashion...really aggressive and not afraid of failure," he added. England will play three T20Is and as many ODIs against India.

194.title: Govt sets up panel to suggest testing SOPs for EV batteries: Report
194.article_body: The government has formed a panel which will formulate an SOP for testing and validation of key components and formulate a certification standard for EV batteries, The Indian Express reported citing an official. "The committee will suggest ways to ensure the right quality of the product," the official added. This comes amid several EV fires reported in the country.

195.title: 3 killed in landslide in K'taka; schools, colleges closed in 4 districts amid heavy rains
195.article_body: At least three persons were killed and one was severely injured in a landslide in Karnataka's Dakshina Kannada amid heavy rains, police said. Following a red alert issued by IMD, authorities announced that Anganwadi schools and colleges will remain closed on Thursday in Udupi, Kodagu, Uttara Kannada and Hassan. Tourists and fishermen have been advised not to go to beaches.

196.title: Initially, Deepika's parents were completely thrown off by me: Ranveer
196.article_body: Ranveer Singh said his wife, actress Deepika Padukone's parents were initially "completely thrown off" by him. "Who's this, what's this? Especially Deepika's mom. She [didn't] know what to make of me," added Ranveer. "I have two wardrobes...When I go to Bangalore, there's a special wardrobe- white T-shirt and blue jeans. I don't want to throw (my in-laws) off," he stated.

197.title: Faridkot DSP arrested for accepting ₹10 lakh bribe from drugs supplier
197.article_body: Punjab Police arrested Faridkot Deputy Superintendent of Police (DSP), Lakhbir Singh, for allegedly accepting a ₹10 lakh bribe from a drugs supplier for not naming him in the FIR. This comes after the supplier was arrested in Tarn Taran with 250 grams of opium and ₹1 lakh in cash. He was already wanted in an FIR from June, police said.

198.title: 9 new cases of BA.4, BA.5 detected in Maharashtra, all from Pune
198.article_body: Maharashtra has detected nine new cases of BA.5 and BA.4 sub-variants of Omicron strain of COVID-19, bringing the overall tally of BA.4 and BA.5 patients in the state to 73, the state health department said. All six patients of BA.5 and three of BA.4 were from Pune, it added. The city also reported 10 new cases of Omicron's BA.2.75 sub-variant.

199.title: 17-yr-old tries to loot jewellery shop taking advantage of heavy rain in Mumbai
199.article_body: A 17-year-old boy tried to loot a Vasai-based jewellery shop by climbing over the asbestos sheet of the shop amid heavy rain in Mumbai. Hearing the noise inside the shop, people gathered and thrashed the accused thief and later informed the shop owner. Taking advantage of the torrential downpour the thief made the attempt, Sub-Inspector Atul Nawale said.

200.title: HomeTown announces 'Mano Ya Na Mano’ sale with up to 50% off
200.article_body: HomeTown announced the 'Mano Ya Na Mano' sale with up to 50% off and 10% moneyback* on purchasing furniture, homeware and home interiors. You can take home leather recliner sofa sets, complete bedroom packages, homeware and much more at shockingly good deals, HomeTown said, adding that SBI Card holders will get extra 5% cashback*. Moneyback is valid till July 14.

201.title: Religious conversion of Hindus stopped: Goa CM on completing 100 days in office
201.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Wednesday said religious conversions of Hindus in the state stopped within 100 days of his government assuming office. "Our government has taken a tough stance on religious conversion...Religious conversions happening for years have been stopped," he added. Furthermore, he said, "We formed SIT to look into illegal land acquisition matter."

202.title: Dhoni attends Nadal's Wimbledon match, celebrates birthday in London; pics surface
202.article_body: Former Team India captain MS Dhoni attended Rafael Nadal's quarter-final match at Wimbledon in London on Wednesday. He then went on to celebrate his 41st birthday in London. Pictures from his birthday celebration have surfaced online. Team India wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant was also seen in attendance during Dhoni's birthday celebrations.

203.title: Dad's cooler, fitter than me: Hrithik on dad Rakesh Roshan's workout video
203.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan took to Instagram to share a video clip of his father Rakesh Roshan working out. "Goals!" the actor wrote. He also used hashtags that said that his dad is cooler and fitter than him. Several celebrities including Farhan Akhtar, Priyank Sharma and Kunal Kapoor reacted to Hrithik's post.

204.title: I struggled initially, but recovery from COVID-19 has been good: Rohit
204.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma, who had missed the Edgbaston Test after testing positive for COVID-19, has said his recovery from the virus has been good and he's feeling nice and healthy. "I resumed training three days ago, and decided to play [first T20I against England]," stated Rohit. "There are no symptoms [now]. I've tested negative two-three times," he added.

205.title: Supporting DOGE wherever possible: Musk on Boring Company accepting DOGE
205.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk, in response to a report saying his firm The Boring Company will accept Dogecoin as payment for rides on its Las Vegas transit system 'Loop', said, "Supporting DOGE wherever possible." Rides are currently free on Loop but the firm reportedly plans to charge eventually. Single rides will cost $1.50, while day passes will cost $2.50.

206.title: Kamal Nath threatened police, administration during his term: MP CM
206.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Wednesday said former CM Kamal Nath used to threaten police and administration during his term and continues to do so. "They've understood that Congress...lost badly and...the defeat has to be blamed on someone," Chouhan added. His comments came after Kamal Nath accused BJP of using police, money and administration for civic polls.

207.title: Moon brought humans together in 1969, Mars can do that in future: Musk
207.article_body: Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to say, "Moon brought us [humans] together in 1969, Mars can do that in the future." He also said humanity will "fight itself" without a common goal. "Humanity will reach Mars in your lifetime," he added. Responding to his tweets a Twitter user said, "I don't believe in the moon landing."

208.title: India reports 18,930 new COVID-19 cases, 35 deaths; active cases rise to 1,19,457
208.article_body: India has reported 18,930 COVID-19 cases, 14,650 recoveries and 35 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 16,159 cases and 28 deaths. Notably, India's active COVID-19 cases jumped to 1,19,457, while the death toll reached 5,25,305.

209.title: What is Apple's new 'Lockdown Mode' for its devices?
209.article_body: Apple's new "Lockdown Mode", which will be coming this fall with iOS 16, iPadOS 16, and macOS Ventura, is an "extreme, optional protection for users who face grave, targeted threats to their digital security". "It will help protect users who may be personally targeted by some of the most sophisticated digital threats, such as...state-sponsored mercenary spyware," Apple said.

210.title: Nobody imagined 'Tu Cheez...' will change everything for Akshay: Boxwala
210.article_body: Producer Shabbir Boxwala said nobody had imagined in their "wildest dreams" that the song 'Tu Cheez Badi Hai Mast' from 1994 film 'Mohra' will change everything for Akshay Kumar. Boxwala, who was the film's production designer, said, "We offered Mohra to Sridevi...However, we didn't have big male stars. Akshay and Suniel [weren't] known...Any heroine would think twice before saying yes."

211.title: Mentally challenged man climbs electric tower in Mumbai; rescued
211.article_body: A 35-year-old mentally challenged man was rescued after he climbed an electric tower near Kasara railway station in Mumbai twice on Wednesday. "He was merely smiling and waving and didn't speak a word...We offered him tea...biscuits and tried to convince him to come down," one of the rescuers said. "The tower is near a high-tension wire," an officer said.

212.title: IAS officer who got 44.8% in Class 10 shares his marksheet
212.article_body: IAS Awanish Sharan, who scored 44.8% in Class 10, has shared his marksheet on Twitter. Reacting to his post, a Twitter user wrote, "I left preparation thinking that UPSC considers only toppers. But you changed my perception today." "You have no idea sir how much you motivate youths like me that nothing is impossible," another user tweeted.

213.title: File your FIRs, will see you in every court in land: Mahua on her remark
213.article_body: Following her remark on goddess Kaali, TMC's Mahua Moitra said, "I do not want to live in an India where BJP's monolithic, patriarchal [and] brahminical view of Hinduism will prevail and rest of us will tiptoe around religion." Furthermore, she tweeted, "I'll defend this till I die. File your FIRs - will see you in every court in land."

214.title: Did backflip, SRK's car stopped in lobby, he said 'You were good': Vidyut
214.article_body: Actor Vidyut Jammwal said that he once did a backflip on ramp during his modelling days. "Shah Rukh sir was in attendance. After the fashion show, we models were waiting in the lobby. And there is this fancy car that comes with silver glasses...car stopped...window goes down and he [Shah Rukh Khan] says, 'Vidyut, you were good'," he added.

215.title: Nadal registers 5-set win over Fritz, reaches his 8th Wimbledon semi-final
215.article_body: Rafael Nadal defeated Taylor Fritz to reach the Wimbledon semi-finals for the eighth time. Nadal lost the first set and took a medical time-out in the second but won the match 3-6, 7-5, 3-6, 7-5, 7-6 (10-4) in four hours and 21 minutes. He will now face Nick Kyrgios, who has reached a Grand Slam semi-final for the first time.

216.title: B'luru ranked 146th on Global Liveability Index, least among Indian cities
216.article_body: Bengaluru has been ranked 146th on the Global Liveability Index 2022 which was released recently by the Economist Intelligence Unit (EIU). The EIU ranked 173 cities across the world which included five Indian cities - Delhi, Mumbai, Chennai, Ahmedabad, and Bengaluru. Bengaluru scored the least out of the five Indian cities with a score of 54.4 out of 100.

217.title: IMD predicts light to moderate rainfall in Hyderabad on Thursday
217.article_body: Hyderabad will witness light to moderate rainfall on Thursday, India Meteorological Department (IMD) predicted. Telangana will likely witness heavy to very heavy rainfall in the next few days, it added. "The districts in southern Telangana are expected to receive heavy to very heavy rainfall...central parts can also experience good rainfall in the next five days," an IMD scientist said.

218.title: I am 'really upset' about my prop status as an actor: Karan Johar
218.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar said he's "really upset" about his "prop status" as an actor, having not been offered any role after Ranbir Kapoor-starrer 'Bombay Velvet'. "If given an opportunity...I might be good," added Karan. Discussing the worst criticism for his hosting skills, Karan stated that he received it from Jaya Bachchan who said he speaks "too loudly" on the stage.

219.title: FTX has "a few billion" to help struggling crypto firms: Billionaire CEO
219.article_body: Cryptocurrency exchange FTX's billionaire CEO Sam Bankman-Fried has said the platform still has "a few billion" on hand to support struggling firms that could further destabilise the crypto industry. "We're starting to get a few more companies reaching out to us," Bankman-Fried said. His firms have recently helped platforms like crypto lenders Voyager Digital and BlockFi.

220.title: Pune 6-yr-old out with mom to get vehicle washed dies as grinder falls on him
220.article_body: A 6-year-old boy died after a grinder machine fell on his head at a workshop when he was out with his mother to get their vehicle washed in Pune. "We have not taken...statement of family members, once they register the FIR we will take further steps," police said. Reports said he was rushed to the hospital but was declared dead.

221.title: 4 held for stealing cash & jewellery worth ₹3 cr from shop in B'luru
221.article_body: Four people from Rajasthan's Chittorgarh were arrested on Wednesday for allegedly stealing cash and jewellery worth around ₹3 crore from a showroom in Bengaluru. "The accused had robbed Ramdev Bankers and Jewellers showroom...at gunpoint," Udaipur SP Vikas Sharma said, adding, "The accused were...handed over to Bengaluru police.'' The robbed items were recovered from accused after a police chase.

222.title: 12 buildings in Kurla to be torn down to avoid collapses: BMC
222.article_body: BMC has decided to bring down all dilapidated buildings in Kurla to avert collapses. Accordingly, it has identified 12 such private buildings categorised as C-1 structures, meaning they are dangerous to inhabit and started issuing notices to occupants to vacate them at the earliest. The decision came after a four-storeyed residential building in Kurla collapsed last week, killing 19 people.

223.title: Lady constable helps woman deliver baby at railway station in Thane
223.article_body: A lady constable of Railway Protection Force (RPF) helped a 30-year-old woman from Thane's Titwala deliver a baby girl at Diva railway station on Wednesday morning. The woman had reportedly fainted at the station following which lady constable Mamta Dangi helped her to a safer spot. Dangi then created a makeshift cloth curtain to help the woman with her delivery.

224.title: 3 stabbed in Karnataka's Kerur, large gatherings banned till Friday
224.article_body: At least three people were stabbed in clashes that broke out between members of two groups on Wednesday in Kerur in Karnataka's Bagalkote. This comes after members of each side accused the other of harassing women. Large gatherings have been banned till Friday as a precautionary measure, police said. Schools and colleges will remain closed on Thursday, police added.

225.title: IAS officer shares pic of MS Dhoni, says 'Why Dhoni is loved'
225.article_body: IAS officer Awanish Sharan took to Twitter on Wednesday to share a picture of former Team India captain MS Dhoni and wrote, "Why Dhoni is loved." In the picture, MS Dhoni can be seen taking a selfie with two female fans. "Dhoni is real inspiration," a fan commented. Dhoni on Thursday turned 41 years old.

226.title: Professor in Bihar returns 33-month salary of ₹24 lakh over students not attending classes
226.article_body: Lallan Kumar, an assistant professor at Nitishwar College in Bihar’s Muzaffarpur, returned his 33-month salary of ₹24 lakh due to students not attending classes. "My conscience doesn't allow...If I take a salary without teaching...it'd be academic death for me," he said. "It's not just absenteeism...but...pressure tactic to get a transfer to postgraduate department," principal Manoj Kumar said.

227.title: FBI, MI5 chiefs warn of threat from China at rare joint address in London
227.article_body: The US' FBI Director Christopher Wray and the UK's MI5 Director General Ken McCallum have cautioned business leaders against threat from the Chinese government, in an unprecedented joint address in London. "We consistently see that it's the Chinese government that poses the biggest long-term threat to our economic and national security...along with our allies in Europe and elsewhere," Wray said.

228.title: Jaya said 'You have a mic, why are you shouting': Karan on hosting criticism
228.article_body: While talking about criticism he has received for his hosting skills, filmmaker Karan Johar said actress Jaya Bachchan asked him why was he shouting when he had mic. "I was like, 'I am trying to be energetic'. She said, 'You have a mic and that's what it is for, you don't need to scream when you are speaking'," he added.

229.title: Elon Musk welcomed twins with one of his top executives last year: Report
229.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk welcomed twins with Shivon Zilis, a top executive at his brain-chip startup Neuralink, in November of 2021, Business Insider reported on Wednesday. In April, Musk and Zilis reportedly filed a petition to change the name of the twins to "have their father's last name" and contain their mother's last name as part of their middle name.

230.title: Who is 1993-born Dr Gurpreet Kaur, Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's bride?
230.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's bride Dr Gurpreet Kaur was born in 1993 and she hails from a village in Pehowa area of Haryana's Kurukshetra district. She completed her MBBS with a gold medal from Maharishi Markandeshwar University at Mullana in Haryana in 2018. Her father is a farmer, while her mother is a homemaker. She has two elder sisters.

231.title: 25 MCD schools to be upgraded as pilot project: Delhi LG
231.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena has said that 25 Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) schools will be upgraded as a pilot project in order to improve teaching, technology and physical infrastructure in civic body-run schools. "Work will be started there at the earliest. The same would gradually be undertaken in all other remaining schools run by MCD," Saxena added.

232.title: Microsoft's $68.7 bn Activision deal faces competition probe in UK
232.article_body: The UK's competition watchdog CMA has opened a probe into Microsoft's $68.7 billion deal to acquire 'Call of Duty' maker Activision Blizzard. The CMA has set a deadline of September 1 for its initial decision. It'll assess whether the deal would reduce competition. Microsoft has said it's "appropriate for regulators to take a close look at this acquisition".

233.title: Pune to have no cuts in water supply between July 8 and 11
233.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) will restore normal water supply to the city's residents from July 8 to July 11 on account of Ashadi Ekadashi and Bakri Eid celebrations on Sunday. PMC will take further decisions on water management after reviewing the situation on July 11. PMC had adopted a 30% water cut by announcing water supply on alternate days.

234.title: Netanyahu received gifts from billionaire: Witness in corruption trial
234.article_body: Ex-Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu had received gifts of champagne, cigars and jewellery from billionaire Arnon Milchan, according to a witness in the corruption trial against Netanyahu. The trial is addressing allegations that while in office, Netanyahu had accepted gifts worth hundreds of thousands of dollars from Milchan and billionaire James Packer. Netanyahu is facing two more corruption cases.

235.title: You have to go 'all in' to be a successful entrepreneur: Anupam Mittal
235.article_body: Shark Tank India judge Anupam Mittal shared a clip on LinkedIn from an interview about his journey as an entrepreneur. Alongside, he wrote, "Money managers think the way to create wealth is to spread your risk...but ask any successful entrepreneur...you'll find that they've gone 'all in'." He added, "Ultimately...it depends on...how much risk allows you to sleep well at night."

236.title: MyGlamm parent The Good Glamm Group to open international division
236.article_body: Beauty firm MyGlamm's parent company The Good Glamm Group has decided to open an international division, as per a statement. The group further said it will consolidate its group companies into independent divisions- brands, media and creators. Last year, The Good Glamm Group acquired content brands such as ScoopWhoop, Miss Malini, The Moms Co among others.

237.title: Google launches Startup School India to enable 10,000 startups
237.article_body: Google India has launched Startup School to enable 10,000 startups in tier II and III cities across the country. With this programme, they aim to provide startup owners with resources and information to expand their business through guided online training. The virtual programme will offer fireside conversations with Google leaders and partners in the startup ecosystem.

238.title: Oil prices drop to 12-week low amid recession, COVID-19 fears
238.article_body: Oil prices on Wednesday dropped to a 12-week low amid fears of a possible global recession and demand cut in China amid new COVID-19 lockdowns. While Brent futures for September delivery fell 2.9% to $99.78 a barrel, US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude fell 3.2% to $96.31. This comes a day after Brent fell 9% and WTI fell 8%.

239.title: Vivo Directors escape from India amid ED inquiry against the Chinese firm: Report
239.article_body: Vivo Directors Zhengshen Ou and Zhang Jie have escaped from India as Enforcement Directorate (ED) intensified inquiry into the money laundering case against the Chinese smartphone manufacturing company, said ANI quoting sources. ED on Tuesday conducted raids at 44 locations of Vivo and related firms. The raids were conducted under sections of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act.

240.title: Jalandhar Police seize 536 passports in illegal immigration racket
240.article_body: The Jalandhar City Police have busted an illegal immigration racket and seized 536 Indian passports. They have arrested four people who were running five unauthorised consultancies and cheated people with promises of sending them abroad. The police also seized cash worth ₹49,000, a laptop and three computers from the possession of the suspects, who are all from Ludhiana.

241.title: US Independence Day parade shooter confesses to carrying out attack
241.article_body: The man charged with killing seven people at an Independence Day parade in the US confessed to the police that he had carried out the mass shooting from a rooftop in suburban Chicago, authorities said. Crimo had appeared in court via a video link on Wednesday. Separately, a police spokesman said that Crimo had "seriously contemplated" carrying out another attack.

242.title: Reduce prices by up to ₹10 within a week: Govt to edible oil firms
242.article_body: The government has directed edible oil manufacturers to cut the MRP of imported cooking oils by up to ₹10 per litre within a week. "Global prices have declined 10% in last one week...This should be passed on to consumers," the government said. It also asked the companies to maintain a uniform MRP of the same brand of oil throughout India.

243.title: Comedian Samay Raina criticised after he tweets joke on abortion
243.article_body: Comedian and YouTuber Samay Raina was criticised after he shared a joke on abortion. "It really takes guts to call yourself a comedian when this is your understanding of...humour," a Twitter user commented. "Even by dark humour standards, this is...crass!" another comment read. "Abortion is not a joke to the ones who [are] going through it," another person commented.

244.title: Nick Kyrgios reaches semi-final of a Grand Slam for the first time ever
244.article_body: World number 40 Nick Kyrgios defeated Cristian Garin in the quarter-final to reach Wimbledon 2022 semi-final. With this, the 27-year-old reached the semi-final of a Grand Slam for the first time. Kyrgios won the quarter-final with a scoreline of 6-4, 6-3, 7-6(7-5). Kyrgios is the first Australian man to reach the singles semi-final at Wimbledon since Lleyton Hewitt in 2005.

245.title: Piyush Goyal urges states to increase sowing of rice
245.article_body: Food Minister Piyush Goyal has urged all states to increase sowing of paddy, saying this season "sowing of rice is 16% lower than the normal level nationally". He clarified there is enough rice stock with the government. However, there is huge demand for rice internationally and the farmers must use this opportunity to export, the minister said.

246.title: S African prez mourns death of teenagers in East London nightclub
246.article_body: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa on Wednesday mourned the death of 21 teenagers in a nightclub in East London last month. The cause of the deaths is still being investigated. In a public funeral attended by over a thousand people, the president said, "We are losing our future generation to the scourge of underage drinking."

247.title: Rhea's career is ruined for no fault of her, she's not getting roles: Rana
247.article_body: Bengali film producer Rana Sarkar said that actress Rhea Chakraborty's career is being jeopardised for no fault of her. "She went through a lot of trouble and she is also not getting roles in Mumbai," he added. "She has been haunted for being someone’s girlfriend and for being Bengali. I genuinely think she deserves better," he said.

248.title: Fake call centre busted in Kolkata; 10 arrested
248.article_body: Kolkata police have busted a fake call centre in the city's Rajarhat sector, arresting 10 people and seizing incriminating electronic material and documents from them. The accused would cheat people living in foreign countries on the pretext of offering technical support in exchange for money. The accused were booked for fraud, cheating and criminal conspiracy.

249.title: Pune City Police arrest 5 who stole fuel from BPCL tankers
249.article_body: The Pune City Police busted a racket and arrested 5 people who stole petrol and diesel from Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited (BPCL) tankers. The police have booked five others whom they suspected were involved in the racket. The police also seized a BPCL tanker worth ₹80 lakh along with cell phones, cash, three diesel cans and motorcycles from the accused.

250.title: 900 inmates escape Nigerian prison in attack blamed on Boko Haram
250.article_body: Nearly 900 inmates escaped from a prison in Nigeria's Abuja during a suspected Boko Haram attack, officials said on Wednesday. Of these, nearly 440 inmates have been recaptured, while the rest of the inmates are still at large, according to a government spokesperson. The suspected Boko Haram attackers came for members who were held in the prison, an official said.

251.title: City Union Bank to raise up to ₹500 crore via QIP route
251.article_body: City Union Bank on Wednesday announced it is planning to raise up to ₹500 crore through the qualified institutional placement (QIP) route. The private lender added that it has called an annual general meeting (AGM) on August 18 to seek approval for the fund-raising proposal. Last year also it obtained shareholders' approval but did not utilise the same, it added.

252.title: Happy that he has resigned: KJ Alphons on Saji Cherian's resignation
252.article_body: BJP MP KJ Alphons has said that he is happy that Saji Cherian has resigned after the latter resigned from the Kerala Cabinet. "It's [a] shame that the ministers feel they can desecrate the Constitution of India," KJ Alphons said. Saji Cherian resigned on Wednesday amid protests over his remarks on the Constitution.

253.title: Reliance Retail signs long-term deal to bring Gap to India
253.article_body: Reliance Retail on Wednesday said it has signed a long-term deal with Gap Inc to sell the US clothing retailer's brands locally. Under the partnership, Reliance will sell Gap merchandise through a mix of exclusive brand stores, multi-brand outlets and e-commerce platforms. With this deal, the company has become the official retailer for Gap across all channels in India.

254.title: Ghulam Ahmad Mir resigns as Jammu and Kashmir Congress chief
254.article_body: Ghulam Ahmad Mir has resigned as the Jammu and Kashmir Pradesh Congress Committee (JKPCC) President. "It is the tradition in the Congress party that before any reshuffle, the existing office-bearers put in their papers. I have done the same," Mir said. Ghulam Ahmad Mir was the JKPCC chief for over seven years.

255.title: After Maha, BJP will now form govts in Raj, WB: Suvendu Adhikari
255.article_body: After rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde-led new government was formed in Maharashtra, BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari said, "After Maharashtra, BJP will form governments even in Rajasthan, West Bengal and Telangana where appeasement politics is rampant." His remarks came a day after BJP Tamil Nadu chief K Annamalai said that Tamil Nadu is also waiting for a 'Shinde' to emerge.

256.title: Droupadi ji will represent a new India: Meghalaya CM
256.article_body: Extending support to NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu, Meghalaya CM Conrad Sangma said she will represent a new India. "She represents hope for every tribal, every girl and every woman and will carry with her the aspirations of small communities of India," Sangma tweeted. Droupadi Murmu, who visited Meghalaya, sought support of the lawmakers for the upcoming Presidential elections.

257.title: Extradited drug fugitive returns to Italy to serve 30-yr prison term
257.article_body: Extradited drug lord Rocco Morabito, who was reportedly Italy's second most-wanted fugitive, has returned to the country to serve a 30-year prison term. He was extradited from Brazil and will now serve his sentence for various drug offences. Morabito, who was absconding for almost 28 years, "became the king of cocaine brokers [there]," an Italian official said.

258.title: Ben Stokes doesn't give a damn what anybody else says: Nasser Hussain
258.article_body: Praising England Test skipper Ben Stokes' captaincy, former England captain Nasser Hussain said, "Stokes doesn't give a damn what anybody else says." Hussain added, "He is doing it his way, to the extent of having Stuart Broad padded up as nightwatchman. When did you last see Broad play a defensive shot?" England have won four Test matches in a row.

259.title: BJP wins 102 of 130 panchayat seats unopposed in Arunachal
259.article_body: The BJP has won unopposed 102 of 130 panchayat seats in Arunachal Pradesh where by-polls are scheduled next week, said state Panchayat Minister Bamang Felix. The Congress, National People's Party and Independents have secured another 14 seats unopposed. The by-election to the remaining seats will be held on July 12.

260.title: D2C bakery brand The Baker's Dozen raises $5 million
260.article_body: Direct-to-Consumer bakery brand The Baker's Dozen (TBD) has raised $5 million in its pre-Series A funding round. The funding was a mix of equity and debt led by Fireside Ventures. The company was founded in 2013 by Sneh Jain and his wife Aditi Handa, who is also the Head Baker. TBD has clocked sales of ₹30 crore in FY22.

261.title: Urban Company to grant ₹74 cr restricted stock unit to US employees
261.article_body: Urban Company's board has passed a resolution to grant restricted stock units (RSUs) worth ₹74 crore ($9.5 million) to its US-based employees. The company will draw 2,800 RSUs from its ESOP (employee stock ownership plan) 2015. The Gurugram-based home services marketplace, which was earlier called UrbanClap, has facilitated ESOP sales worth ₹100 crore for its 940 employees till date.

262.title: Bidi factory workers protest for higher wages in Kolkata
262.article_body: Bidi factory workers from across West Bengal protested in Kolkata on Wednesday, demanding a hike in wages, a standard pay structure and medical benefits. "They pay us only ₹116 for binding 1,000 bidis. The munshi (middleman) does nothing for us," said a worker. Centre of Indian Trade Union led the protest demonstrations.

263.title: RBI announces steps to boost forex inflows amid falling rupee
263.article_body: The RBI on Wednesday announced various measures to enhance foreign exchange inflows amid the rupee losing about 6% against the US dollar so far this year. The measures include allowing overseas investors to buy short-term corporate debt and purchase more government securities under the fully accessible route. India's forex reserves have fallen over $40 billion in the last nine months.

264.title: Hold Goa Panchayat polls in 45 days: SC upholds Bombay HC order
264.article_body: The Supreme Court upheld Bombay High Court's order which asked that a notification be issued to hold elections to 186 Panchayats in Goa within the next 45 days. The Goa government filed a plea requesting an extension till September to conduct the polls. The apex court said that it did not find a reason to interfere in the election process.

265.title: Goa govt geared up for e-auctioning of iron ore mining leases: CM
265.article_body: The Goa government is geared up to initiate the process of e-auctioning of iron ore mining leases, CM Pramod Sawant announced. Notably, mining activities had come to a halt in 2018 after the apex court had cancelled the second renewal of 88 mining leases granted in 2015. The government has initiated the process of taking over these leases, he said.

266.title: Centre releases revenue deficit grant of ₹7,183 crore to 14 states
266.article_body: The Finance Ministry on Wednesday released the fourth instalment of Post Devolution Revenue Deficit (PDRD) Grant of ₹7,183.42 crore to 14 states for the current fiscal. With this, the total amount of PDRD grants released to the states in 2022-23 stands at ₹28,733.67 crore. The states will get a total revenue deficit grant of ₹86,201 crore in FY23.

267.title: Used-car startup Kavak to invest $180 mn to expand into 4 more countries
267.article_body: Mexican used-car startup Kavak is planning to invest $180 million to expand into four more countries, namely Colombia, Chile, Peru and Turkey. Kavak offers clients used cars online and through brick-and-mortar hubs. Turkey will be its first location outside Latin America. "The expansion is something the company needs to do, but we're doing it conservatively," CEO Carlos Garcia Ottati said.

268.title: Ex-TikTok gaming head to launch blockchain games startup 'Meta0'
268.article_body: Jason Fung, the former head of TikTok's gaming unit, is set to launch a blockchain games startup called Meta0. The 34-year old said he gave up his "cushy" corporate life at TikTok to offer a "more interoperable" infrastructure option to developers of blockchain games. "Right now, [developers]...have to choose a single blockchain," he said. Fung will act as Meta0's Co-founder.

269.title: SC stays Madras HC order on AIADMK leadership issue
269.article_body: The Supreme Court has stayed the Madras High Court's order which stopped the AIADMK from passing resolutions on the party's single leadership issue. The apex court was responding to a plea filed by former Chief Minister Edappadi Palaniswami. The Supreme Court stay aids the dominant faction within the AIADMK which is pushing for Palaniswami to be the party's top leader.

270.title: I don't think Uddhav-led Sena expects us to return to them: Shinde
270.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde on Wednesday ruled out the possibility of going back to Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena. CM Shinde said, "I don't think they (Uddhav Thackeray faction) [expect] us to return to them especially after the way they are accusing us." Talking about forming government with BJP in Maharashtra, Shinde said he did not repent for his decision.

271.title: Salesforce to offer $2 mn grant for workforce development in India
271.article_body: Salesforce has announced a $2 million local grant to 22 non-profits across India for education and workforce development. "These grants are expected to impact over 40,000 individuals in India," said Arundhati Bhattacharya, CEO and Chairperson of Salesforce India. Further, as part of another initiative, it plans to plant one million trees in India by 2030.

272.title: 90% of students at JNU are apolitical, 10% are troublemakers: VC
272.article_body: During an interview, Jawaharlal Nehru University Vice Chancellor Santishree Dhulipudi Pandit on Wednesday claimed that 90% of JNU students are apolitical and only 10% are troublemakers who think they can build their political careers at the varsity. She said that JNU isn't a place for pursuing political aspirations. "You come here to study, you come here to learn," she added.

273.title: 12 cult members charged with murder of 8-yr-old girl in Australia
273.article_body: At least 12 members of a cult were arrested and charged with the murder of an 8-year-old girl who died due to lack of medical treatment in Australia's Toowoomba. The victim, Elizabeth Rose Struhs, who was suffering from type-1 diabetes, was allegedly denied insulin access by the cult. The group believed that Elizabeth would be "healed by god", police said.

274.title: Holiday in Dakshina Kannada educational institutes tomorrow due to rains
274.article_body: The Dakshina Kannada district administration in Karnataka has declared a holiday for all educational institutions on July 7 (Thursday) in the wake of a red alert for rainfall issued in the district. The IMD said that extremely heavy rainfall is likely in Dakshina Kannada, Udupi and Uttara Kannada districts. The rainfall is likely to range above 204.5 mm.

275.title: 1 arrested for supplying poison that killed 9 of family in Sangli
275.article_body: Police have arrested a person from Talegaon Dabhade in Maharashtra for allegedly supplying poison to the prime accused in last month's murder of nine people from the same family in Sangli district. Prime accused Abbas Mohammad Bagwan and his driver Dheeraj Chandrakant Survase were arrested on June 26. Bagwan had reportedly taken a large loan from the victim family.

276.title: Salman's lawyer claims he got death threat letter saying 'enemy's friend is an enemy'
276.article_body: A lawyer representing Salman Khan in a blackbuck poaching case claimed he received a death threat letter from the Lawrence Bishnoi gang. Police have initiated investigation to ascertain authenticity of the threat letter and deployed a policeman with him for his security. The letter allegedly said the lawyer will meet Sidhu Moosewala's fate, adding an "enemy's friend is [an] enemy".

277.title: He has found joy in it: Kevin on brother Nick Jonas embracing fatherhood
277.article_body: Singer Kevin Jonas said he's happy for his younger brother, Nick Jonas who became a father recently. Speaking about Nick embracing fatherhood, Kevin told a news portal, "He has really found so much joy in it. We're just really happy for him." Nick and his wife Priyanka Chopra became parents to daughter Malti Marie Chopra Jonas in January 2022.

278.title: Not every film needs to bring numbers like RRR: 'Modern Love...' director
278.article_body: Modern Love Hyderabad director Nagesh Kukunoor said he's confident that the audience will react positively to storytelling attempts like the Modern Love series. "I...believe there is an audience for everything. That’s how I've managed to survive for 25 years," he added. "Not every film needs to bring...numbers like 'RRR'. There are big films, mid-level films and small ones," he added.

279.title: Happiest moment: Twinkle shares pic of man selling pirated versions of her books
279.article_body: Actor turned author Twinkle Khanna on Wednesday shared a picture of a man who was selling her books' pirated copies. Sharing the picture, Twinkle wrote, "How do you know a book has done well...The real acid test of being...bonafide bestseller though is when pirated versions of your books are sold at traffic lights. This was one of my happiest moments."

280.title: Rajasthan govt to appoint Kanhaiya Lal's 2 sons to state service
280.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Wednesday announced that the state Cabinet has decided to appoint the two sons of Kanhaiya Lal, who was beheaded in Udaipur last month, to state service. Gehlot said there is no other source of livelihood in the family of the deceased. He added that with this decision, the family will get financial and mental strength.

281.title: Shiv Sena nominates Rajan Vichare as its chief whip in Lok Sabha
281.article_body: The Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena has nominated Rajan Vichare as its chief whip in Lok Sabha replacing Bhavana Gawali. She was one of the party MPs to suggest that Shiv Sena ally with the BJP. Earlier in the day, Sena MLA Gulabrao Patil claimed that 12 party MPs would soon join the faction led by CM Eknath Shinde.

282.title: Irani, Scindia assigned additional portfolios after 2 Union Ministers resign
282.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani has been assigned the charge of Ministry of Minority Affairs in addition to her existing portfolio of Women and Child Development after Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi's resignation. Meanwhile, Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia has been assigned the additional charge of Ministry of Steel charge after Union Minister RCP Singh resigned.

283.title: Crisis-hit Sri Lanka seeks credit support from Russia to import fuel
283.article_body: Sri Lanka's President Gotabaya Rajapaksa on Wednesday said that he had requested credit support from Russia to help the cash-strapped nation import fuel amid a severe economic crisis. Rajapaksa made the request during a call with Russian President Vladimir Putin. Separately, Sri Lanka plans to hold road shows in five Indian cities to attract more tourists, its Tourism Minister said.

284.title: Avoid non-essential travel to Sri Lanka: New Zealand tells citizens
284.article_body: Amid Sri Lanka's ongoing economic crisis, New Zealand on Wednesday issued a travel advisory asking citizens to avoid non-essential travel to the cash-strapped country. The advisory stated that travellers should have contingency plans as they might face a shortage of supplies, including food and fuel. New Zealand citizens residing in Sri Lanka were also asked to avoid protest sites.

285.title: Athlete PT Usha, composer Ilaiyaraaja, 2 others nominated to Rajya Sabha
285.article_body: Former Olympic Track and Field Athlete PT Usha, music composer Ilaiyaraaja, filmmaker Vijayendra Prasad and philanthropist Veerendra Heggade were nominated to Rajya Sabha on Wednesday. PM Narendra Modi took to Twitter to congratulate them. "The remarkable PT Usha Ji is an inspiration for every Indian," he wrote for the athlete. "Glad that he has been nominated," he wrote for Ilaiyaraaja.

286.title: Punishing a nuclear power is threat to humanity: Ex-Russia Prez to US
286.article_body: Ex-Russian President Dmitry Medvedev told the US on Wednesday that attempts by the West to punish Russia over its military offensive in Ukraine risked threatening humanity. "Punishing a country that has one of the largest nuclear potentials is absurd," Medvedev added. Notably, Russia and US possess about 90% of the world's nuclear warheads, according to a US-based think tank.

287.title: Pant becomes highest-ranked Indian Test batter, achieves his career-best ranking
287.article_body: Team India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant has become the highest-ranked Indian Test batter in the latest rankings. The 24-year-old has moved six places to the fifth position to achieve his highest-ever position in the rankings for Test batters. Team India captain Rohit Sharma, who is ranked ninth, is the second-highest ranked Indian Test batter.

288.title: Man shares pics showing price difference between Zomato online & offline bills
288.article_body: A LinkedIn user has made a comparison of Zomato online and offline food bills of the same order. Rahul Kabra, a Performance Marketing Manager, shared the photos and wrote, "Cost escalation 34.76% per order at INR 178 = (690-512)/512." "Assuming Zomato brings visibility and more orders to the food service provider, should it charge such high price?" he added.

289.title: I've been in constant touch with officials: PM amid Assam floods
289.article_body: Amid the ongoing flood situation in Assam, PM Narendra Modi said, "Assam is facing the challenges of floods. Normal life has been affected. CM Himanta Biswa Sarma and his team are working continuously on relief operations." "I've been in constant touch with...officials and the people in Assam," he added. So far, over 170 people have died in Assam amid floods.

290.title: I want to play a superhero of Indian origin in Avengers: Taapsee Pannu
290.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu said she wants to play a superhero. "Please ask Marvel...this is the only wish list I have," she added. "I want to be a part of Avengers, I want to play...superhero of Indian origin. That’s all I'm trying to manifest. So if anyone tells me a way to go about it, I'll follow it," Taapsee said.

291.title: Nigerian arrested with 80 grams of cocaine worth ₹24 lakh in Mumbai
291.article_body: Police said that a 32-year-old Nigerian national, Chukwuma Ogbonna Nwaeke, was arrested with 80 grams of cocaine worth ₹24 lakh by Anti-Narcotics Cell (ANC) of Mumbai crime branch. Nwaeke, who was moving suspiciously in Santacruz area, started running after seeing the police vehicle and was arrested after a chase, an official said, adding he was carrying a bag containing cocaine.

292.title: 4 women who tricked & robbed train passengers arrested in Aurangabad
292.article_body: Four women, who were a part of a notorious gang robbing long-distance railway passengers of their belongings, were arrested by Government Railway Police (GRP) crime branch in Aurangabad on Wednesday. Officers said the women would travel to Mumbai from Aurangabad every two or three days. "They would...board different, random long-distance trains pretending to be travelling alone," police said.

293.title: Ensure constant supply of sanitary pads in schools: HC to Delhi govt
293.article_body: The Delhi High Court has directed the Delhi government to ensure a constant supply of sanitary napkins to girl students in government-aided schools under the Kishori Yojana scheme. The Directorate of Education informed the court that an e-tender had been floated for this. School authorities had been given funds to procure sanitary napkins from the government's e-marketplace, DoE said.

294.title: Expecting 4 cr pilgrims to visit U'khand during Kanwar Yatra: CM
294.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami on Wednesday said the government is expecting as many as four crore pilgrims to visit the state during the upcoming Kanwar Yatra. "We'll ensure a hassle-free journey for all," Dhami said, while speaking at Uttarakhand Startup Conclave and Grand Challenge 2022. "Pilgrims are partaking in the ongoing Char Dham Yatra in record-breaking numbers," he added.

295.title: Elephant birth blocks Kerala-Tamil Nadu road for 1 hour
295.article_body: A road connecting Kerala and Tamil Nadu in Idukki district was blocked for an hour as an elephant was giving birth in the middle of the road, a forest department official said. The road was blocked by the herd as the mother gave birth, preventing vehicular movement. After the mother walked away with her calf, the road was cleared.

296.title: 2 boys, aged 6 & 9, drown in a village pond in MP's Damoh district
296.article_body: Two minor boys, aged six and nine years, drowned in a village pond while they were playing in Madhya Pradesh's Damoh, police said on Wednesday. The boys had left their homes in the afternoon and did not return till late evening, after which their families started looking for them, police said. Their bodies were found floating in the pond.

297.title: Actor Rana Jung Bahadur arrested for making objectionable remarks against Lord Valmiki
297.article_body: Actor Rana Jung Bahadur was arrested on Wednesday, a day after a court in Punjab's Jalandhar rejected his anticipatory bail plea, for allegedly making objectionable remarks against Lord Valmiki on a TV show. His remarks had led to protests in Jalandhar, with members of Valmiki community also calling for a bandh on July 11.

298.title: Australian tennis star Nick Kyrgios charged with assaulting ex-girlfriend
298.article_body: Australian tennis star Nick Kyrgios will appear before a Canberra court next month after being charged with assaulting his ex-girlfriend last year, local police said on Tuesday. If found guilty, Kyrgios could face a maximum sentence of two years in prison, reports said. Kyrgios' lawyer confirmed that the 27-year-old will make a statement in due course.

299.title: Speech fabricated to weaken LDF: Saji after resigning as Kerala Minister
299.article_body: After resigning from the Kerala Cabinet, Saji Cherian said he never defamed the Constitution. "I have resigned and it's my personal decision...A particular part from the speech was taken and the media fabricated it to weaken the CPI(M) and the LDF," he said. Cherian resigned amid protests over his remarks on the Constitution.

300.title: Modi ji's gift to Indian households: KTR on LPG price hike
300.article_body: Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao criticised Prime Minister Narendra Modi-led central government for the increase in gas cylinder prices and said it was Modi ji's gift to all Indian households. "LPG over ₹1,050. An increase again of ₹50," he tweeted. His comment comes after the price of a 14.2-kg domestic LPG cylinder was increased by ₹50 today.

301.title: Landslide near Pratapgad fort in Maharashtra, no casualty reported
301.article_body: A landslide occurred on a road leading to the Pratapgad fort in Maharashtra's Satara district on Wednesday after heavy rains. No casualty was reported, according to officials of Satara district administration. "After receiving information, our team reached the spot and cleared the debris from the road," Public Works Department's executive engineer, Sanjay Sonawane, said.

302.title: Authorities nab 39 suspects over migrant smuggling on boats to UK
302.article_body: At least 39 suspects allegedly involved in the smuggling of migrants via boats to UK have been arrested by authorities in a Europe-wide operation. The suspects have been accused of smuggling as many as 10,000 people on small boats across English Channel to UK. Notably, this comes months after 27 UK-bound migrants drowned off France's coast after their boat capsized.

303.title: Dolo-650 manufacturer's Bengaluru office raided by Income Tax Department
303.article_body: The Income Tax Department on Wednesday conducted searches at the premises of Bengaluru-based pharmaceutical company Micro Labs Ltd, the manufacturers of Dolo-650 tablet, on charges of tax evasion, officials said. They added that the department is looking at financial documents, balance sheets and business distributor networks of the company as part of the searches.

304.title: Ranbir Kapoor and Vaani have sensual chemistry in Shamshera: Karan Malhotra
304.article_body: Speaking about Ranbir Kapoor and Vaani Kapoor in 'Shamshera', filmmaker Karan Malhotra said, "Ranbir and Vaani have sensual chemistry...Their characters were written in a way to show how attraction leads to love and how...their love blooms in crisis." "Our song 'Fitoor', will show their dynamic chemistry, and I hope people love how...gorgeous they look together," he said.

305.title: Tendulkar shares pic with Ranveer on his b'day, says 'Any guesses when this was clicked?'
305.article_body: Former Indian cricketer Sachin Tendulkar took to Instagram to share an old picture with actor Ranveer Singh on the occasion of his birthday on Wednesday. "Happy Birthday, Ranveer! Have a great year ahead. Found this picture of ours...Any guesses when this was clicked?" he wrote in the caption. The photo also features Ranveer's father Jagjit Singh Bhavnani.

306.title: Virat Kohli records his worst Test ranking in 6 years, drops out of top 10
306.article_body: Ex-Team India captain Virat Kohli has recorded his worst Test ranking in around six years after dropping out of the top 10. Kohli managed scores of 11 and 20 against England in the Edgbaston Test and dropped to the 13th position in the latest rankings for Test batters. The last time Kohli was ranked below 10 was in November 2016.

307.title: Junior can marry only after elder brother: Raghav Chadha to Punjab CM
307.article_body: AAP leader Raghav Chadha extended his wishes to party colleague and Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann ahead of his wedding. Sharing a photo with Mann, Chadha said junior's number comes only after elder brother. He added, "Best wishes to my [big brother] Mann Saab and Dr Gurpreet Kaur for a happy and blessed married life." Mann will get married on Thursday.

308.title: Nepal's Finance Minister resigns amid parliamentary probe
308.article_body: Nepal's Finance Minister Janardan Sharma resigned on Wednesday after the formation of an 11-member parliamentary committee to probe allegations of unauthorised changes to the federal budget. Sharma is accused of inviting unauthorised persons to make changes to tax rates in the budget for fiscal year 2022-23. The changes were allegedly made a day before the budget was presented in Parliament.

309.title: PM Modi's weak China policy will cost India for decades: Owaisi
309.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Wednesday said that PM Narendra Modi's weak China policy will cost India for decades. His response came after the Centre approved 80 foreign direct investment proposals from Chinese entities. "After restricting Chinese investments in India, Modi has now done a u-turn and started approving FDI proposals from China," he added.

310.title: Smoke detected inside IndiGo flight after landing in Indore
310.article_body: Smoke was detected in the cabin of a Raipur-Indore IndiGo flight after landing on Tuesday, the aviation regulator Directorate General of Civil Aviation said on Wednesday. All the passengers were able to deboard from the A320 Neo aircraft safely, and the incident is being investigated by DGCA, according to reports.

311.title: Complaint filed against Nawazuddin's wife for not paying dues of ₹31 lakh: Reports
311.article_body: A police complaint has reportedly been filed against Nawazuddin Siddiqui’s wife Aaliya Siddiqui by Manju Garhwal, co-producer of her debut production venture, over non-payment of Rs 31 lakh dues. In her complaint, Garhwal alleged she has been trying to communicate with Aaliya but she isn't responding. Manju also accused Aaliya of causing her mental agony and harassment, reports added.

312.title: Authorities order mass COVID-19 testing in parts of Shanghai, Beijing
312.article_body: Chinese authorities have ordered a new round of mass COVID-19 testing in parts of Shanghai and Beijing after the discovery of new cases in the two cities. This comes as tight restrictions remain in place in Hong Kong, Macao and some other Chinese cities. Notably, Shanghai had ended its strict coronavirus lockdown a few weeks ago.

313.title: Indian Coast Guard rescues 22 ship crew members near Gujarat coast
313.article_body: Indian Coast Guard on Wednesday rescued 22 crew members of a sinking ship off the coast of Gujarat, which was on its way to Karnataka from UAE. The crew members were rescued after they issued a distress alert as their ship, MT Global King, started flooding. Among those rescued are 20 Indians and one Pakistani and Sri Lankan national each.

314.title: We've become laboratory of human rights violations: WB Guv
314.article_body: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar on Wednesday said that the state is becoming a laboratory of human rights violations and urged the Bengali intelligentsia to break their silence on the "decimation of democratic values". "The greatest threat to democracy and which we cannot allow to happen is extreme appeasement," he further added.

315.title: Headlines managed, economy mismanaged: Rahul after LPG price hike
315.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi criticised the Centre over the price hike of LPG cylinders by ₹50 and accused the BJP government of managing headlines, but mismanaging the economy. He added that in 2014, inflation used to be the headline, but now there's no discussion of the LPG price hike, even when it has become costlier by ₹50.

316.title: PM Modi to inaugurate 3-day seminar on NEP in Varanasi on July 7
316.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will inaugurate a three-day seminar on the implementation of the National Education Policy (NEP) across the country, in Varanasi on Thursday. The event, which is being organised by the Union Education Ministry, will see over 300 senior dignitaries in attendance. UP CM Yogi Adityanath and Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan will be present on the occasion.

317.title: Woman passenger conceals 1kg gold in rectum, caught at Hyd airport
317.article_body: A woman passenger was caught by the Hyderabad Customs officials for trying to smuggle over 1kg of gold, officials said. The gold was valued at ₹64.38 lakh and was concealed in her rectum, which was later caught by the air intelligence unit of the Hyderabad Customs, reports said. Further investigation is underway, officials added.

318.title: Hyd woman accused of running brothels detained under PD Act
318.article_body: A woman who has been accused of running prostitution rings was detained under the Preventive Detention Act and was sent to Hyderabad's Chanchalguda prison. Rachakonda Police Commissioner Mahesh Bhagwat invoked the PD Act against the accused woman, who has been involving women and young girls from Mumbai, Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka and other regions into prostitution.

319.title: India's coal production rises 32.57% year-on-year in June 2022
319.article_body: The Ministry of Coal on Wednesday said that the coal production has risen by 32.57% to 67.59 million tonnes (MT) in June 2022 from 50.98 MT in June 2021. Likewise, coal-based power generation registered a growth of 26.58% in June 2022 as compared to June 2021. The overall power generation in June 2022 was 17.73% higher year-on-year, it added.

320.title: Food Ministry calls meeting of edible oil firms for reduction in prices
320.article_body: The Food Ministry has called a meeting on Wednesday with edible oil companies to discuss reduction in the MRPs of cooking oils, Food Secretary Sudhanshu Pandey said. He added, "We'll tell them to pass on the benefits of reduction in global prices...to consumers." In the last one month, global prices have reportedly fallen $300-$450 per tonnes of different edible oils.

321.title: Kerala Minister Saji Cherian resigns amid protest over anti-Constitution remark
321.article_body: Kerala Culture Minister Saji Cherian on Wednesday announced his resignation from the state Cabinet amid protests over his remarks on the Constitution. He had said that the Indian Constitution endorses the exploitation and loot of the common people. He later expressed regret and said, "I respect our Constitution...The news that I criticised the Constitution is twisted."

322.title: Passenger safety is paramount: Scindia as SpiceJet gets notice over snags
322.article_body: After the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) issued a show cause notice to SpiceJet over the recent malfunction incidents, Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya M Scindia said passenger safety is paramount. "Even the smallest error hindering safety will be thoroughly investigated and course-corrected," he added. The airline has reported eight malfunction incidents in the last 18 days.

323.title: Nepotism refuses to leave me, I'm still cursed, trolled & abused for it: Karan
323.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar spoke about nepotism and revealed the topic refused to leave him. "It started on...(Koffee With Karan) and that's never the industry, it's never left social media, by and large, I'm still cursed, trolled, and abused for it," he said. "Now I'm not bothered. It went from annoyance to amusement. Now I'm amused every time," he added.

324.title: Voyager Digital files for bankruptcy, 2nd crypto firm to do so in days
324.article_body: Cryptocurrency lender Voyager Digital has filed for Chapter 11 of the US Bankruptcy Code, which allows reorganisation of debts. In its filing, the US-headquartered firm estimated it had over 10,000 creditors, $1-$10 billion in assets and liabilities worth the same value. Last week, it issued a default notice to crypto hedge fund Three Arrows Capital, which later filed for bankruptcy.

325.title: Man flashes his private part at woman at Delhi metro station, arrested a month after her tweets
325.article_body: A man named Manav Agarwal has been arrested for allegedly flashing his private part at a woman at Delhi's Jor Bagh Metro Station, a month after her tweets about the ordeal were circulated on social media. "I asked [police] to do something...instead they started victim blaming me," she had claimed. Manav went to Nepal to escape arrest, police said.

326.title: Sports tech startup Hudle raises $1 million in Series A round
326.article_body: Hudle, a sports technology startup, has raised funding of $1 million as part of their ongoing Series A funding round led by Inflection Point Ventures (IPV). Existing investors Survam Partners and Indian Angel Network also participated in the round. Hudle is a mobile app which enables people to book various sports activities in more than 750 venues across India.

327.title: VC firm Axilor Ventures launches second fund of $100 million
327.article_body: Venture Capital firm Axilor Ventures has announced the launch of its early-stage fund with a corpus of $100 million. The Category-I Axilor Technology Fund II (ATF-II) will fund early-stage startups. ATF-II has been set up as a 15-year fund to allow it to stay with seed companies longer, as per Ganapathy Venugopal, Co-founder and CEO of Axilor Ventures.

328.title: 11-yr-old Prathamesh from 'Shark Tank' demonstrates Braille gadget to PM
328.article_body: At the ongoing Digital India Week 2022, 11-year-old Prathamesh Sinha demonstrated a Braille self-learning gadget called Annie to PM Narendra Modi. Annie is a product of Anand Mahindra-backed Thinkerbell Labs. The visually-impaired child, who was the youngest contestant of 'Shark Tank India', introduced himself to the PM as the company's brand ambassador. The PM praised him for his confidence.

329.title: Russia signs pact to supply tech for Kudankulam Nuclear Power Plant
329.article_body: A unit of Russia's state-owned nuclear energy corporation Rosatom has signed a deal to supply state-of-the-art tech for Kudankulam Nuclear Power Plant (KNPP) in Tamil Nadu, The Economic Times reported. As per Rosatom, the deal is for supplying thermocouples (temperature measuring transducers) for four units of KNPP. In total, it will supply 200 units of resistance thermocouples labelled TSPT 5963.

330.title: 4 held for stealing laptops from B'luru store, 110 laptops seized
330.article_body: Bengaluru City Police have arrested four persons who were involved in stealing laptops from a computer store, the city's police informed on its official Twitter handle on Wednesday. Moreover, the police informed that 110 laptops of different brands, estimated to be worth around ₹5 lakh, have been seized from their possession. Further investigation into the matter is underway, police added.

331.title: RCP Singh resigns as minister from PM Modi's Cabinet
331.article_body: RCP Singh submitted his resignation as the Union Minister of Steel to Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday. Singh is a minister in the Modi Cabinet from the JD(U) quota. Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi has also resigned as the Union Cabinet Minister of Minority Affairs. This comes a day ahead of their Rajya Sabha term getting over.

332.title: IIT Guwahati designs electricity-free cooler as alternative to ACs
332.article_body: Researchers at IIT Guwahati have developed a passive radiative cooler which can operate without electricity. The cooling system can be applied on rooftops and can function both during day and night time. The cooler requires no external energy sources for its operation and can work as an alternative to conventional air conditioners to cool buildings and automobiles, the institute said.

333.title: If audiences like me, they'll watch a film irrespective of language: Nithya
333.article_body: Actress Nithya Menen, who worked in Malayalam, Telugu, Tamil and Hindi films, said her fans often ask her to star in a movie of their language. "Every time you see the comments, they'll say when are you doing...film in this language?" she added. "I feel, if you like me, watch it" "I wish people didn't feel like that," she said.

334.title: 4 of electronics firm booked for cheating supplier of ₹1.18 cr in Thane
334.article_body: Four directors of a Delhi-based electronics company were booked for allegedly cheating a supplier from Thane of over ₹1.18 crore, police said. The accused had placed an order for 10,000 street lights with the victim's company in 2019. They paid ₹59 lakh, but failed to pay the remaining sum, which with the interest worked out to ₹1.18 crore, police added.

335.title: Assam, Meghalaya recorded highest June rainfall since 1966: IMD
335.article_body: India Meteorological Department has said that Assam and Meghalaya recorded the highest June rainfall since 1966. According to IMD's climate summary, Assam and Meghalaya recorded 858.1 mm rainfall in June, breaking the earlier record of 789.5 mm in 1966. It's also estimated that over 190 persons died and 50 went missing due to landslides and heavy rain in June.

336.title: B'luru to get its first animal waste processing plant soon: Report
336.article_body: A task force set up by Mahadevapura MLA Aravind Limbavali along with the local administration has decided to build Bengaluru's first animal waste processing plant to tackle the issue of unmanaged animal waste, reports said. The initial capacity of the plant will be 20 tonnes. The plant is being built in three phases at a cost of ₹15-18 crore.

337.title: Lightning strikes kill 3 in separate incidents in Rajasthan's Bundi
337.article_body: Three people were killed in lightning strikes in two separate incidents in Rajasthan's Bundi, police said on Wednesday. A 65-year-old man, Banwari Mehar, and his 60-year-old wife Nandudevi of Balkasa village were killed on Tuesday after lightning struck them while they were working in a field, police said. In a similar incident, 65-year-old Gyarsibai Dhakad was killed in Kethooda village.

338.title: Ensure potholes are repaired: Maha CM after biker's death in Thane
338.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Wednesday reprimanded officials after a 37-year-old man was run over by a bus after his motorcycle bumped into a pothole in Thane. During a meeting with the municipal corporations across the Thane district, CM Shinde asked officials to ensure that the potholes are repaired. "Officials should go out on...field and survey the roads," he added.

339.title: BBMP chief inspects major junctions in B'luru to decongest traffic
339.article_body: BBMP Chief Commissioner Tushar Giri Nath, along with Additional Chief Secretary to state government Rakesh Singh, on Tuesday conducted a joint inspection to chalk out plans to decongest major junctions in Bengaluru. The officials inspected Sarakki junction, junction near Jayadeva hospital and Central Silk Board junction. They instructed BESCOM to remove name plates to make way for pedestrians.

340.title: Tuition teacher assaults 5-year-old child in Patna, arrested
340.article_body: Police on Wednesday arrested a man, who runs a private coaching institute in Patna, for allegedly beating up a five-year-old student. The accused, identified as Amar Kant, assaulted the boy until he lost consciousness, police said. Kant, who was absconding after the child's parents filed a complaint, was caught and booked under relevant sections of IPC and Juvenile Justice Act.

341.title: Govt reduces gap for COVID-19 precaution dose from 9 months to 6 months for all above 18
341.article_body: Government has reduced the duration between second dose of COVID-19 vaccine and precaution dose from the existing 9 months to 6 months for all beneficiaries above the age of 18. For beneficiaries aged 60 and above, as well as health care workers and frontline workers, precaution dose would be administered after completion of 6 months, free of charge.

342.title: Cong MP says ₹1.50-lakh pen lost at Yashwant Sinha's event, files complaint
342.article_body: Tamil Nadu Congress MP Vijay Vasanth has filed a police complaint that his pen worth ₹1.50 lakh has been missing since he attended an event for Opposition's presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha in Chennai. He said his late father H Vasantha Kumar, who was MP from Kanniyakumari, had given him the pen. He added the pen was very special to him.

343.title: Taken aback by attack on Moitra; urge people to 'lighten up': Tharoor
343.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Wednesday said he is "taken aback by the attack" on Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra for her comments on Goddess Kaali. He also urged people to "lighten up and leave religion" to individuals to practise privately. "To me, Kaali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess," Moitra had previously said.

344.title: 2 house burglars caught in B'luru; ₹1.7 lakh cash recovered
344.article_body: Police have arrested two persons for their alleged involvement in a house burglary in Bengaluru. Police officials have recovered ₹1.7 lakh cash and 272 grams of gold jewellery and 997 grams of silver ornaments worth ₹16 lakh from their possession, the city's Deputy Commissioner of Police (West Division) Laxman Nimbargi said. Nimbargi also shared a picture of the recovered items.

345.title: Underwater drones that can carry 200 kg of drugs seized in Spain
345.article_body: Spanish police have seized three underwater drones used by drug traffickers to ship narcotics across the Strait of Gibraltar into Spain, Interior Ministry said. The sea-borne devices were designed to carry up to 200 kg of drugs. Spanish police said it was the first time they've seized such devices. Police have arrested eight people as part of the 14-month investigation.

346.title: 2 sent to judicial custody for assaulting lady constable in Gurugram
346.article_body: Two persons were produced in a city court on Tuesday and sent into judicial custody for allegedly misbehaving, manhandling and abusing a lady head constable in Gurugram. The incident happened in the premises of sector 40 police station. The accused had arrived at the police station with a man to file a complaint against him for stealing their scooty.

347.title: Iran methodically basing itself in Red Sea: Israel Defence Min
347.article_body: Israeli Defence Minister Benny Gantz on Tuesday said that "Iran is methodically basing itself in the Red Sea, with the greatest presence seen over the past decade".
