"It's a direct threat to international trade, energy supply, and the global economy," he added. The Defence Minister also released satellite pictures of four Iranian warships allegedly patrolling the Red Sea.

348.title: China seeks new golden era of ties with Philippines: Chinese Min
348.article_body: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi on Wednesday said that China is ready to work with new Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr to "open a new golden era" in the bilateral relationship. "I am grateful to Minister Wang Yi for extending the message of congratulations and support from President Xi Jinping," Marcos Jr tweeted after his meeting with the Foreign Minister.

349.title: I'll never pressurise anyone: Karan on Ranbir refusing to appear on 'Koffee...'
349.article_body: When asked about why actor Ranbir Kapoor refused to appear on his show 'Koffee With Karan 7', despite being a good friend, filmmaker Karan Johar said, "[Ranbir] said, 'I'm not coming, kuch gadbad ho jayega, it'll stay with me for life'." "I'll never pressurise anybody, because I feel you have to come off your own free will," he added.

350.title: Suspected thief injured in police firing in Assam's Kokrajhar
350.article_body: A suspected thief was injured in police firing in Assam's Kokrajhar district, police said on Wednesday. The accused tried to snatch the pistol of an officer and run away, police said, adding that he was hospitalised. With this, 54 people have been killed and at least 140 others injured in police action while trying to flee custody since May 2021.

351.title: Emergency declared in Balochistan's Quetta as heavy rains kill 25
351.article_body: At least 25 people were killed and several others injured due to heavy rainfall and flash floods in Balochistan over the last two days. Pakistan's Provincial Disaster Management Authority has declared an Emergency in the Quetta district. According to officials, as many as 50 mud houses collapsed in the Sariab Mills area, Eastern Bypass and other places.

352.title: Alstom wins Bhopal, Indore metro rail project order worth ₹3,200 cr
352.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Metro Rail Corporation Limited (MPMRCL) has awarded France-based Alstom an order worth ₹3,200 crore to deliver 156 Movia metro cars for Bhopal and Indore metro rail projects. The contract also includes comprehensive maintenance and installation of latest generation of Communications Based Train Control (CBTC) signalling system. The trains will be built at Alstom's Gujarat facility.

353.title: IAS officer Tina Dabi takes charge as Jaisalmer Collector, shares pics from new office
353.article_body: IAS officer Tina Dabi, a UPSC 2015 exam topper, on Wednesday took charge as the District Collector and Magistrate of Jaisalmer in Rajasthan. Dabi, who was earlier posted in Jaipur as a joint secretary in the finance department of Rajasthan government, shared the news on social media with pictures of herself working in her new office.

354.title: JP Morgan cuts price target for Tesla as deliveries drop for 1st time in 2 yrs
354.article_body: JP Morgan analysts cut their price target for Tesla shares by $10 to $385 as it reported fall in deliveries for the first time in two years. The analysts said Tesla's production and financial results could be affected by execution issues at its new factories in Texas and Berlin. Recently, CEO Elon Musk described both factories as "gigantic money furnaces".

355.title: Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi resigns as Union Minister of Minority Affairs
355.article_body: Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi resigned as the Union Cabinet Minister of Minority Affairs on Wednesday, ANI reported. His term as Rajya Sabha MP is set to end soon. The resignation comes hours after reports claimed that Prime Minister Narendra Modi praised him at the Cabinet meeting for his contribution to the country and people.

356.title: I had to sell my office due to the COVID-19 pandemic: Ram Gopal Varma
356.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma said he had to sell his office because of the COVID-19 pandemic. Talking about his films not doing well during the COVID-19 pandemic, the filmmaker who directed 'Satya' stated, "During this time, a lot of films by a lot of people [haven't] done well. It is not just about my films, but no one targets others."

357.title: Lees used to bat like Boycott, but now he's batting aggressively: Vaughan
357.article_body: Former England captain Michael Vaughan has said England batters are changing their batting style according to the new 'aggressive' approach of captain Ben Stokes and Test head coach Brendon McCullum. "Players like Alex Lees, who only 6 weeks ago was batting like Geoffrey Boycott, wanted to bat for long periods of time...has [now] come out batting aggressively," explained Vaughan.

358.title: Business is currently firm for our chip industry: Taiwan amid slowdown
358.article_body: Taiwan's Economy Minister Wang Mei-hua said on Wednesday that the business for the country's semiconductor industry is currently "firm". The order books of Taiwan's chip firms "are still very full", she added. Her assurance came after American chip manufacturer Micron Technology said last week that the chip market had "weakened considerably in a very short period of time".

359.title: Congress denied probe into Shyama Prasad Mukherjee's death: JP Nadda
359.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda, on the birth anniversary of Shyama Prasad Mukherjee, said the Congress denied an inquiry into the "mysterious" death of the leader. "Only Congress and Nehru know why...inquiry was not conducted," Nadda added. He further lauded PM Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah for scrapping Article 370 in J&K, calling it a "true tribute" to Mukherjee.

360.title: Delhi Congress leader Tarvinder Singh Marwah joins BJP
360.article_body: Congress leader Tarvinder Singh Marwah, who was an MLA for three terms in the Delhi Assembly, joined the BJP on Wednesday. Speaking to reporters, Marwah criticised Congress leadership for allegedly ignoring longtime members and appealed to all the G-23 leaders of Congress to join BJP. He further praised PM Narendra Modi, saying that there has been no PM like him.

361.title: TRS leader celebrates birthday on Hyderabad road, causes traffic jam
361.article_body: Telangana Rashtra Samithi leader and former Hyderabad mayor Bonthu Rammohan and his supporters played music and burst crackers to celebrate his birthday on a road in Hyderabad. Reports said that the celebrations caused a traffic jam and blocked the way for commuters. The TRS leader reportedly sprayed champagne before brandishing handheld crackers in both hands, Times Now reported.

362.title: How can India still qualify for World Test Championship final?
362.article_body: India are currently fourth on WTC points table. India can take their percentage of points won to 68.05% if they win each of their remaining six fixtures. India would need to beat Australia 4-0 and expect them to lose at least four more matches for a better chance to qualify. India would also need South Africa to lose three matches.

363.title: Always been in awe of your kindness: Madhavan on Hrithik's Rocketry tweet
363.article_body: Reacting to Hrithik Roshan's tweet on actor R Madhavan's recent film 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect', the latter tweeted, "I have always been in awe of your kindness bro..but this is another level." "It means the world to...[me]. You will always be my special hero," added Madhavan. "The brilliant word-of-mouth for Rocketry...has left me with FOMO!" read the tweet from Hrithik.

364.title: I bury face in pillow, can't see his pic without breaking down: Saira on Dilip
364.article_body: Ahead of late actor Dilip Kumar's death anniversary, his wife Saira Banu said she cannot look at the late actor's picture without breaking down. "I...bury my face in the pillow and try to go back to sleep... as if by doing so I will...see him sleeping by my side...Not a moment passes...when he is not before my eyes," she added.

365.title: LPG costliest for Indians while unemployment at peak: Varun Gandhi
365.article_body: BJP MP Varun Gandhi said that at a time when unemployment is at its peak, Indians have to buy LPG at the highest price in the world. The statement comes after domestic LPG cylinder's price was increased by ₹50. "The connection cost increased from ₹1,450 to ₹2,200," Gandhi said. "The poor's kitchen is filling with smoke again," he added.

366.title: Spirit of our culture can't be trivialised by anybody: Singhvi on Mahua's remark
366.article_body: Congress leader Abhishek Singhvi reacted to TMC's Mahua Moitra's remark on goddess Kaali, saying that people must be careful when they "play" with emotions of people, which are reflected in such symbols, culture and faith. "Heart and spirit of our culture cannot be trivialised by anybody, anywhere be it elsewhere, abroad or here," he added.

367.title: B'luru college students complain of overflowing toilet waste on campus
367.article_body: The students of Bengaluru's Sri Jayachamarajendra Polytechnic College have complained of overflowing toilet waste near the campus gate, canteen and classrooms. A student said, "Stinking smell from the toilet waste is unbearable...It's difficult to focus on classroom teaching." Meanwhile, the NSUI has submitted a report to the Principal Secretary of Higher Education, seeking immediate intervention.

368.title: Ruturaj won't get opportunity in 1st England T20I: Aakash Chopra
368.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said Ruturaj Gaikwad is unlikely to feature in India's XI for the first T20I against England. "Rohit is back...Who goes out? Ruturaj won't get another opportunity but will Sanju Samson retain his place?" asked Aakash. Ruturaj scored 3 runs in the first T20 warm-up game against Derbyshire. The first T20I will be played on Thursday.

369.title: Tamil Nadu waiting for an Eknath Shinde: State BJP chief Annamalai
369.article_body: Following a change of regime in Maharashtra, state BJP chief K Annamalai said that Tamil Nadu is also gearing up for a cabinet shuffle. "Tamil Nadu cabinet headed by DMK leader M K Stalin is also...waiting for an Eknath Shinde to emerge," he claimed. DMK, however, described Annamalai's comments as "insignificant" and said "the party is not taking him seriously".

370.title: ED summons crypto exchanges, seeks info under FEMA: Reports
370.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED), which is probing alleged instances of foreign exchange violations, has summoned CoinSwitch Kuber, CoinDCX and other crypto exchanges in the case, as per reports. The agency is reportedly seeking details like transaction history under Foreign Exchange Management Act (FEMA). "ED is examining every detail on offshore transactions," an official told The Economic Times.

371.title: Tibetan issue not only political matter but matter of truth: Dalai Lama
371.article_body: Tibetan issue is not only a political matter but a matter of truth, Dalai Lama said on Wednesday. "What we have is truth on our side," he added. "We have not been telling lies. We have been sincere in our struggle. So, for all these years I've worked sincerely, respecting law," he stated.

372.title: Bangkok-Delhi Vistara flight lands at Delhi airport on a single engine, passengers safe
372.article_body: A Bangkok-Delhi Vistara flight landed at Delhi airport on Tuesday on a single engine. The airline said that the crew decided to tow the aircraft to the parking bay keeping in mind passenger safety and comfort. All the passengers are safe and the matter was reported to Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA).

373.title: China's BYD surpasses Tesla to become world's top-selling EV brand: Report
373.article_body: Chinese automaker BYD has reportedly surpassed Elon Musk's Tesla to become the world's top-selling electronic vehicle (EV) brand in the first half of 2022. While BYD sold 641,000 EVs between January and June this year, the figure stood at 564,000 for Tesla, Financial Times reported. Tesla's supply and production chain was disrupted after China imposed lockdowns due to COVID-19.

374.title: 76-million-year-old dinosaur skeleton to be auctioned in New York
374.article_body: A skeleton of a Gorgosaurus dinosaur that roamed on the earth about 76 million years ago will be auctioned for the first time, auction house Sotheby's announced. The Gorgosaurus skeleton will highlight Sotheby's natural history auction in New York on July 28, it added. The Gorgosaurus, an apex carnivore, predates its relative the Tyrannosaurus rex by 10 million years.

375.title: Launch of second version of Vande Bharat trains in Aug: Ashwini Vaishnaw
375.article_body: Minister for Railways Ashwini Vaishnaw has said that the Indian Railways will launch an upgraded second version of the semi-high-speed Vande Bharat trains in August 2022. "The first two trains started operating in 2019. So far, both the trains have travelled 14 lakh kilometres," he added. "Last year, 75 more trains [were] approved that are under production," Vaishnaw stated.

376.title: Hyderabad civic body raises awareness on mosquito-borne diseases
376.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has asked people to take steps to stop the spread of infectious and seasonal diseases during the monsoon season. The civic body is working to raise awareness on mosquito-borne illnesses. GHMC officials also conducted door-to-door fever examinations and carried out fogging operations.

377.title: India asks Sri Lanka to make advance payments for fuel: Report
377.article_body: India is seeking advance payments for fuel shipments to cash-strapped Sri Lanka amid the latter's ongoing economic crisis, Bloomberg has reported. India has already extended assistance worth $3.5 billion to Sri Lanka in form of supplies, including food and fuel. Sri Lanka needs $587 million to pay for fuel shipments, a minister had earlier said.

378.title: We've reached a stage where one can't say anything on religion: Tharoor on Mahua's remark
378.article_body: Following a controversy over TMC MP Mahua Moitra's remarks on Goddess Kali, Congress leader Shashi Tharoor tweeted, "We've reached a stage where no one can say anything publicly about any aspect of religion without someone claiming to be offended." Tharoor said he was taken aback by the attack on Moitra as Hindus know that forms of worship vary across India.

379.title: Facing Djokovic at Wimbledon is one of the most difficult tasks in tennis: Norrie
379.article_body: World number 12 Cameron Norrie, who'll face Novak Djokovic in Wimbledon 2022 semi-final, has said facing Djokovic on grass is one of the most difficult tasks in tennis. "I'd say that grass is his favourite surface, and his track record is unbelievable...I will have to improve my level," he added. Djokovic is unbeaten in his last 26 matches at Wimbledon.

380.title: French engine maker Safran to set up MRO facility in Hyderabad
380.article_body: French engine maker Safran will set up a maintenance, repair and overhaul (MRO) facility in Hyderabad with investment of $150 million. The facility will be for LEAP-1A and LEAP-1B engines being used in aircraft by both Indian and foreign commercial airlines. The defence ministry said the MRO facility will be able to overhaul more than 250 engines per year initially.

381.title: Told Uddhav we aren't getting any benefit from MVA: CM Shinde
381.article_body: Maharashtra's newly appointed CM Eknath Shinde said that he had told former CM Uddhav Thackeray that they [Shiv Sena] are not getting any benefit from Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA). "Despite our party's CM, we came at number four in Nagar Panchayat [polls]...We tried but we didn't succeed [in making him understand]," Shinde said on Wednesday.

382.title: Bus service from West Bengal's Siliguri to Kathmandu begins
382.article_body: State Transport Minister Firhad Hakim flagged off a bus service between Siliguri in West Bengal and Kathmandu in Nepal on Wednesday. The 40-seater bus will operate from Siliguri on Monday, Wednesday and Friday every week and will depart for Kathmandu at 3 pm. Tickets are available at ₹1,500 per person. The service will boost tourism in the region, officials said.

383.title: PM wishes 'long life & good health' to Dalai Lama on his 87th birthday
383.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi greeted Dalai Lama on his 87th birthday during a phone call on Wednesday. "We pray for his long life and good health," PM Modi tweeted. The Tibetan spiritual leader, who has been living in exile in India after fleeing China in 1959, was also greeted by several other political leaders from the country.

384.title: Shanghai shuts karaoke venues after recent COVID-19 outbreak
384.article_body: KTV karaoke venues have been ordered to shut in Shanghai after a recent outbreak of COVID-19 from one such venue in the city. Cultural places like libraries will, however, be allowed to stay open. The cinemas and performance venues will also be allowed to reopen from Friday as per schedule, according to an official.

385.title: 4 drug peddlers arrested in B'luru; 70 grams of MDMA crystals seized
385.article_body: The Narcotics Squad of Bengaluru City Police's Central Crime Branch (CCB) has arrested four drug peddlers, who are said to be from Kerala, the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime), Raman Gupta, said on Tuesday. Four iPhones and 70 grams of MDMA crystals, estimated to be worth ₹11 lakh, have been seized from their possession, Gupta added.

386.title: Toronto apologises after Sikh guards fired over 'no-beard policy'
386.article_body: Canada's Toronto has apologised to a prominent Sikh organisation for delay in reinstating Sikh security guards who were fired over 'no-beard policy'. Over 100 guards were terminated from several establishments after they were required to shave their beards so that they could wear N95 masks. City officials will allow 'under-mask beard covers' for people who wish to maintain facial hair.

387.title: Lalu Prasad Yadav to be shifted to Delhi, Bihar CM meets him at Patna hospital
387.article_body: RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav, who fractured his shoulder after falling off stairs, will be shifted to Delhi, RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav said. Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Wednesday met the RJD chief at Paras Hospital in Patna, where he has been admitted currently. "If situation calls for us to take him to Singapore, we will," Tejashwi added.

388.title: All in politics called to enquire about Lalu Yadav’s health: Tejashwi
388.article_body: Former Bihar CM Lalu Prasad Yadav's son Tejashwi Yadav on Wednesday said that everyone in politics, including Rahul Gandhi and PM Narendra Modi, called to enquire about the ex-CM's health condition. "Everyone knows about his kidney & heart issues for which treatment was going on in Delhi," he said. We're in this together, he added.

389.title: 'Kaali' film director's old tweet on PM Modi surfaces amid controversy over poster
389.article_body: Indian-born Canada-based filmmaker Leena Manimekalai's 2013 tweet on PM Narendra Modi has resurfaced amid controversy over her film Kaali's poster. "I will surrender my passports, ration card, PAN card and my citizenship if ever Modi becomes this country's PM in my lifetime. I swear," she wrote. Sharing her tweet, filmmaker Ashoke Pandit said, "You've not stuck to your commitment."

390.title: Dutch university recovers $511,302 paid in ransom in 2019 hack
390.article_body: The University of Maastricht has recovered a ransom it paid in Bitcoin to hackers in 2019. The Netherlands Public Prosecution Service was able to seize cryptocurrencies worth approximately $511,302. "While it may seem like a lot of money, it is significantly less than the damage the university actually suffered as a result of the attack," the university said.

391.title: Ex-BJP worker, husband named in K'taka PSI exam scam first charge-sheet
391.article_body: A former BJP worker, Divya Hagaragi, and her husband have been named in the first charge-sheet filed in the Karnataka PSI exam scam case. The headmaster of a school, owned by Hagaragi, and three teachers at the school have also been named. The school served as an examination centre for the PSI recruitment exam in October 2021.

392.title: Fire breaks out at car showroom in Gurugram, 6 tenders rushed to spot
392.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a car showroom in Gurugram where two employees were trapped, officials said on Tuesday. Around six tenders were rushed to the spot and the fire was doused within an hour. The incident took place when employees turned on an AC on the first floor. Records of the company, chairs and tables were destroyed.

393.title: Locals turn giant pothole into a 'beach' for protest in MP, pics go viral
393.article_body: Locals in the Anuppur district of Madhya Pradesh staged a unique protest by turning a giant pothole into a community 'beach'. Locals decorated the area around the pothole with flowers, placed benches and set up food stalls for the protest. The idea for the protest came after repeated requests to repair the run-down road elicited no response from the administration.

394.title: Nearly ₹15 crore raised for 2-yr-old boy orphaned in US mass shooting
394.article_body: Nearly $1,900,000 (₹15 crore) has been raised for the 2-year-old boy who was found wandering alone at the US Independence Day parade shooting site after his parents were killed in the massacre. Aiden was unharmed and was handed over to his grandparents. The GoFundMe page was established to help Aiden's family with "raising, caring for and supporting" him.

395.title: 9 govt school teachers in UP use fake documents to secure job, booked
395.article_body: Services of nine government primary school teachers were terminated in UP's Pratapgarh for allegedly using fake certificates to secure teaching posts, an official said. FIR was lodged against the teachers. The action was taken when an online verification of the TET documents of these teachers, appointed in October 2020, revealed that their qualifying certificates are fake, the official added.

396.title: India squad for ODI series against West Indies announced, Shikhar Dhawan named captain
396.article_body: Team India squad for the three-match ODI series against West Indies has been announced. Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, Rishabh Pant and Jasprit Bumrah have been rested, while Shikhar Dhawan has been named the captain. Shubman Gill, who last played an ODI in December 2020, has also been included in the 16-member squad. Ravindra Jadeja has been named vice-captain.

397.title: Everyone does everything together in the Kapoor family: Alia Bhatt
397.article_body: Discussing her experience as a part of the Kapoor family following her marriage to Ranbir Kapoor, Alia Bhatt said, "[I've] been brought up between me, my mum, my sister and my father...Our interaction was very limited." "We [didn't] have these massive celebrations...Everybody did their own thing...Enter the Kapoor family, where everyone does everything [like eating, aarti] together," added Alia.

398.title: Pair of Shinde, Fadnavis to make Maha prosper: Fadnavis' wife Amruta
398.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis' wife Amruta Fadnavis said that the "ED pair", CM Eknath Shinde and Devendra Fadnavis, will make the state prosper with their hard work. "Difficult situations change but strong people always last," Amruta added. On Tuesday, state Deputy CM said, "We'll work round the clock to make Maharashtra the number one state in [India]."

399.title: Lt Gen Subramanian appointed as Force Commander of UN Mission in S Sudan
399.article_body: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres has appointed Lieutenant General Mohan Subramanian of the Indian Army as his new Force Commander of the UN Mission in South Sudan (UNMISS). He succeeds Lieutenant General Shailesh Tinaikar of India. Subramanian "most recently...served as the General Officer Commanding, Military Region (Operational and Logistic Readiness Zone) in central India", the UN said.

400.title: For me, fitness is feeling good about myself: Anil Kapoor on staying fit at 65
400.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor, in a new video, revealed his fitness routine at 65 and said that it included proper sleep and a balanced diet. "For me, fitness is feeling good about myself. I try and balance it with my workouts," he added. "My trainer Mark makes a plan...and I do exactly what he tells me to do," Anil said.

401.title: Amarnath Yatra resumes after suspension due to bad weather
401.article_body: A day after remaining suspended due to bad weather, Amarnath Yatra resumed on Wednesday morning, as another batch of 5,982 left from Jammu towards the Valley. "Of these 3,363 are going to Pahalgam base camp while 2,619 are going to Baltal base camp," officials said. Over 65,000 have visited the shrine this year since the yatra started on June 30.
